characters: THE SOUNDS OF BATTLE RETURN. A LOUD EXPLOSION --
-- CAMERA SPINS, SO THE BLACK PEARL IS RIGHT SIDE UP --
CAMERA MOVES AROUND THE ROLLING SHIP, PAST THE SURFACE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PIRATE CABIN BOY stands on the gallows. A noose is fitt around his neck. Among the PIRATES in line, a TUNE begins hummed low. Then the Cabin Boy begins to sing, low and wavering, focu only on the song and not those who have come see him hang

dialogues.speaker: CABIN BOY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yo, ho, haul together, hoist the colours high ... heave ho, thieves and beggars, never shall we die... The Cabin Boy closes his eyes -- IN THE BLACKNESS, a SILVER COIN FALLS, tumbling slowly. I SILVER PIECE OF EIGHT, irregular, golden light glinting o rough surface --

dialogues.speaker: CABIN BOY
dialogues.text: The king and his men stole the queen from her bed and bound her in her bones ... BACK TO SCENE: as a PIRATE waiting joins in, sings low:

dialogues.speaker: PIRATE
dialogues.text: The seas be ours and by the powers where we will -- we'll roam... In the crowd stands SIR CUTLER BECKETT among OFFICERS of EAST INDIA TRADING COMPANY. He frowns at the waiting prisoners, as more pick up the song:

dialogues.speaker: PRISONERS
dialogues.text: Yo, ho, haul together, hoist the colours high ... heave ho, thieves and beggars, never say we die... Beckett gives a nod. A wood-SQUEAK, THUNK as the gallows trap-door opens -- IN DARKNESS, the SILVER PIECE OF EIGHT tumbles and turns 500 501 502 503 504  505 506 507 508 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 2. AT THE GALLOWS, the line of Pirates watch with dread and fascination as the young man dances his final dance. Anot is led to the noose --

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Some men have died and some are alive And others sail on the sea -- with the keys to the cage ... and the devil to pay ... we lay to Fiddler's Green! AT THE GALLOWS, another SQUEAK, THUNK and CRY as the hapl Pirate falls to his doom --

dialogues.speaker: ALL PIRATES
dialogues.text: Yo, ho, haul together, hoist the colours high -- HEAVE HO, THIEVES AND BEGGARS, NEVER SHALL WE DIE ... A lever pulled. Another pirate SWINGS. A rope tightens. Another pirate HANGS. Faster and faster. Beckett smiles. DOZEN PIRATES now dangle at the END of their ROPES -- and FINAL PIRATE drops down, boots CLOSE IN FRAME -- The SILVER PIECE OF EIGHT lands on a table, spins and wob a stop. TEAGUE, Pirate Lord of Madagascar, stares out a w the weight of ill news in his eyes. Behind him, on a table, lies the Silver Piece of Eight, n to a candle, an open envelope, and letter Teague's hand picks up the coin, clutches it -- and the c

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO BLACK
dialogues.text: A PAUSE, then ... a WOMAN'S VOICE out of the DARKNESS ...

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The bell has been raised from its watery grave ... do you hear its sepulchral tone? A small boat emerges out of the gloom. Elizabeth moves it with a long pole through a maze of pylons. We are --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junks crammed together around ramshackle docks. Criss-cro shadows from hanging lamps. UNDER THE DOCKS, Elizabeth moves past raised platforms, s an OLD LADY crouches, gutting fish ... an ARTISAN blows g 505 506 507 508  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 3. over a coal FIRE ... a LAUGHING BOY outside a FIREWORKS S lights a pinwheel; it spins, sparks flying -- The SHADOW of a MONKEY races past. Elizabeth's apprehensi grows. It's all weird, surreal. She keeps singing --

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: A call to all, pay heed the squall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the dock, Elizabeth ties the bow line.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: -- and turn your sails toward home! Yo ho, haul together -- EAST INDIA COMPANY MEN, including MERCER, approach. She r ties the line as they pass. Then resumes the song.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Raise the colors high! Heave ho --

dialogues.speaker: HUANG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: -- thieves and beggars, never say we die. THREE GUARDS appear out of the darkness of a huge sewer p Their leader is TAI HUANG.

dialogues.speaker: HUANG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A dangerous song to be singing, for any who are ignorant of its meaning. Particularly a woman. Particularly a woman alone.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What makes you think she's alone? The Guards turn. BARBOSSA stands behind them, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: HUANG
dialogues.text: You protect her?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: What makes you think I need protection? Huang shouldn't have turned away: her knife is at his thr

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Your master is expecting us. (to Elizabeth) And an unexpected death would cast a slight pall on our meeting.  510 511 512 513 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 4. Elizabeth lowers the knife.

dialogues.speaker: HUANG
dialogues.text: You're Captain Barbossa.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Aye. And she be Elizabeth Swann. And Sao Feng has promised us safe passage.

dialogues.speaker: HUANG
dialogues.text: For as long as it suits him. Huang turns to lead them away -- stops, holds up a hand. East India Company AGENTS go past. Huang gestures 'follow me' and leads them toward the huge sewer pipe --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The East India Company Agents keep a look out. DROP DOWN the water below -- IN THE WATER, a dozen or so COCONUTS float lazily with th current. And then one rises up -- the TOP of PINTEL's hea Others rise out of the water -- coconut shells worn like helmets by GIBBS, RAGETTI, COTTON and MARTY. They carry oilskin bundles, take out large rasps, wait, p to file through the bars of a metal grate -- ON THE AGENTS: as they hear wheels SQUEAKING, turn to see TIA DALMA, pushing a cart carrying bird cages with twitte canaries; potions, bottles and bags of flour. Cotton's PA perches atop; JACK THE MONKEY turns the crank of an ORGAN BENEATH THE DOCK -- Gibbs and his crew begin filing throu grate, the noise covered by the music --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Huang leads Barbossa and Elizabeth toward the door of low-slung, decrepit bath house. The two confer in whisper

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Have we heard anything from Will?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: The whelp is more than capable of taking care of himself. But you, in the presence of Sao Feng, you'll be wanting to show a bit more diffidence than is your custom.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: He's that terrifying, is he? 510 511 512 513  514 515 516 517 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 5.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: He's much like myself, absent my merciful nature and sense of fair play. Huang raps out a signal on the door. A slit opens, eyes s him, the slit closes, the door opens --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pintel and Ragetti keep filing -- until suddenly the musi STOPS. Ragetti files one stroke too many, oops -- ON THE DOCKS, one of the Agents regards the Monkey, holdi with the tip of his sword. The other pokes at the cart.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: (to Tia Dalma) You can't be here. Tia Dalma lifts her face -- they see she is BLIND.

dialogues.speaker: TIA DALMA
dialogues.text: Your mother always knew it be you who threw the linens down the well. But she forgave you for it.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: How did you know that?

dialogues.speaker: TIA DALMA
dialogues.text: The canaries. She grins a black-teeth smile. The Agents jump back. Jack the Monkey goes back to grinding, the music picks up -- BELOW, Pintel and Ragetti return to sawing -- 516

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huang stops, bars Barbossa and Elizabeth's way.

dialogues.speaker: HUANG
dialogues.text: No weapons. Remove them, please.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Of course. Barbossa and Elizabeth lose their swords, pistols. Huang holds up a hand to stop Elizabeth. He gestures to her coa

dialogues.speaker: HUANG
dialogues.text: Did you you think because she is a woman, we would not suspect her of treachery?  518 519 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 6.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: When you put it that way ...

dialogues.speaker: HUANG
dialogues.text: Remove, please. Elizabeth strips off her coat. Huang takes it, and reveal two swords in hidden scabbards in the lining. Again, they start past -- Huang stops Elizabeth. AGAIN. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: HUANG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Remove. Please. Elizabeth looks indignant --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON ELIZABETH, self-conscious in a short robe and nothing else. She and Barbossa follow a DRAGON TATTOOED half-nake pirate into the bath house. They move past algae-covered tubs and leaky, rusted pipes. Elizabeth notes: all of the men have the same DRAGON TATTOO. SAO FENG steps out of a tub; two attendants -- LIAN and P (in corset-like outfits) -- dress him in full pirate garb Sao Feng does not acknowledge Barbossa and Elizabeth's presence. Barbossa gets it; he must speak first.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Captain Sao Feng. Thank you for granting me this audience.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: Captain Barbossa! Welcome to Singapore. (to a guard) More steam. The Guard bangs on the wall twice --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two short ATTENDANTS work the boiler and bellow system th feeds steam to the bathhouse above. Gibbs crawls out of a tunnel, followed by Pintel, Ragetti, Cotton ... and then Marty, who did not have to crawl. They see the attendants smile at each other -- no problem -- A HUGE ATTENDANT comes into view. Problem. Ragetti moves crawl back into the tunnel. Gibbs grabs his collar --

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: (sotto) None of that. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 518 519  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 7.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If things don't go the way we want, then we're the only chance we have it won't go as bad as we expect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEAM issues from the pipes. Sao Feng leans over a vent, waving it into his face.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: I understand that you have a request to make of me ..?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: And a proposal to make to you. I've a venture underway, and I find myself in need of a ship and a crew.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: And you consider me worthy of such an honor? A ship and crew ... (a chuckle) Huh. That's an odd coincidence.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Because you happen to have a ship and a crew you don't need? Barbossa gives her a warning glance.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: No. Because earlier this day, not far from here, a thief broke into my most revered uncle's temple, and tried to make off with these ... Sao Feng crosses to a wizened OLD MAN, who clutches ANCIE CHARTS to his chest. Sao Feng tries to take them -- but t Old Man really does not want to let them go. A look from Sao Feng, and the man releases them.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Navigational charts. The route to the Farthest Gate. (Barbossa's smile falters slightly) Wouldn't it be amazing if this venture of yours took you to the world beyond this one?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: It would strain credulity, at that.  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 8. Sao Feng gazes at him levelly. He nods to two GUARDS near one of the baths. The Guards haul a FIGURE out of the tan It's WILLIAM TURNER. He gasps for breath. Sao Feng grabs by the hair, displays his face to Elizabeth and Barbossa.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: This is the thief. Is his face familiar to you? Both play it cool: neither have ever seen him before. Sao Feng studies them, shrugs -- and picks up a huge FID --

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No? Then I guess he has no further need for it. He prepares to stab Will with the fid -- Elizabeth tenses Sao Feng spots the tell. His pleasant demeanor is gone.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You come into my city, you seek my indulgence and largesse, and you betray my hospitality? You betray me?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Sao Feng, I assure you, I had no idea --

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: -- that he would get caught. Sao Feng stares. Barbossa shrugs: yeah, okay.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You intend to attempt a voyage to Davy Jones' Locker. And I cannot help but wonder: why? Barbossa tosses something to Sao Feng, who catches it -- silver PIECE OF EIGHT. Sao Feng examines it.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A piece of eight. (looks up at Barbossa) It's true, then?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Aye. The time is upon us. We must convene the Brethren Court. He BANGS twice on the wall. No steam.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: More steam!  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty sits atop the huge Attendant, tightening a knot. Co puzzles out the boiler mechanism. Gibbs, Pintel and Raget move out of the room, further under the bathhouse --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sao Feng leans over a vent, breathes in the soothing stea

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: The Court has not met in my lifetime.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Nor mine. Sao Feng toys with a Captain's knot pendant at his neck.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: And when last it did, my father told me, it ended ... badly.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: But the time before that, it produced the Code, which has served us well and it was the very first meeting what gave us no less than rule of the sea herself, didn't it? And now that rule is being challenged.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: The East India Trading Company.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: (nods) Lord Cutler Beckett is a pox on us all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oilskin bundles are unrolled: swords, pistols and grenade The pirates place the grenades in the floor joists. Ragetti's attention is drawn to a knothole. He peeks thro Gets a better angle with his wooden eye. It catches Pinte attention. Ragetti point up, mouths "Elizabeth!"

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: There is a price on all our heads it is true. It seems the only way a pirate can turn a profit anymore ... (he regards Will) . is by betraying other pirates. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (back to Barbossa) But pirates are either Captain or crew, and nine squabbling captains trying to chart a course is eight captains too many. Against the company, what value is the Brethren Court? What can any of us do?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: You can fight. She realizes she said that out loud. All eyes on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pintel shoves Ragetti aside, peers through the knothole -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth steps forward:

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: You are Sao Feng, the Pirate Lord of Singapore. You command in the Age of Piracy, where bold Captains sail free waters, where waves are not measured in feet but increments of fear, and those who pass the test become legend. A huge dragon TATTOO GUY steps forward to put a hand on Elizabeth's shoulder. She shrugs him off, continues:

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Would you have that era come to an end on your watch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pintel flinches at the sight, gives Ragetti a dismayed lo what are you smoking, dude?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: But here you are: your ships crowd the harbor, rotting on their lines, while you cower in your bath water Sao Feng regards her, makes a circle around her

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: Elizabeth Swann ... There is more to you than meets the eye, isn't there? And the eye does not go wanting.  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 11. He smiles charmingly at her -- she can't help but smile b

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Barbossa) But I can't help but notice you have failed to answer my question. What is it you seek in Davy Jones' Locker?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Jack Sparrow. Sao Feng freezes. The room goes dead still, too.

dialogues.speaker: WILL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He's one of the pirate lords. Park, one of the twins, giggles at the name -- stops smil when Sao Feng glares at her. LIAN hides her own smile. Sa Feng works to hide his rage.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: The only reason I would want Jack Sparrow returned from the realm of the dead is so I can send him back myself.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Exactly why we preferred his name go unmentioned. UNDER THIS: Sao Feng spots: The DRAGON TATTOO of one of h Guards is MELTING -- STENG.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: So you admit you have deceived me.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Jack Sparrow holds one of the Nine Pieces of Eight! He failed pass it along to a successor before he died. And so we must go and fetch him back -- Sao Feng catches Huang's eye, directs him toward Steng

dialogues.speaker: WEAPONS
dialogues.text: Sao Feng's men (and women) produce weapons from beneath t water in the tubs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs and the others exchange a glance -- it's gone bad -  530 531 532 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbossa and Elizabeth are suddenly at the center of a ri of weapons pointed at them.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: I assure you our intentions are strictly honorable -- He has his hands spread wide -- and then, suddenly, SWORD are pushed up through the floor boards ... and Barbossa f himself holding a sword in each hand. Crap. Elizabeth has two swords; she tosses one across the room to Will. Sao Feng holds the point of the fid to Steng's face.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: Drop your weapons, or I kill your man! Barbossa frowns. Confused looks from Barbossa to Will to Elizbeth. Back to Sao Feng. Barbossa shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Kill him. He's not our man.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: If he's not with you, and not us ... who is he with? The question is answered as suddenly EAST INDIA TRADING COMPANY AGENTS storm in -- CRASHING through windows -- Instantly, the Pirates turn back-to-back to face this new threat. Sao Feng spins away from Steng to fight. Will grabs another sword from below and wades into the ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pintel and Ragetti light a fuse, to a grenade attached to one of the joists -- EXPLOSION --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BATH HOUSE IS ROCKED, and half the floorboards drop d making a ramp. Gibbs, Marty, Cotton, Pintel and Ragetti r in, firing pistols, join the fighting -- As MERCER strides in with a phalanx of SOLDIERS. Lian att him with a sword; he fires at her, killing her point blan Park pulls a steel chopstick out of her hair, sets out fo vengeance. Pirates flee and scatter --  533 534 535 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our heroes flee down ramps, up ladders, swing on ropes. E India Trading Company AGENTS fire pistols, engage with sw Amid the fighting, a stack of crates is knocked over. Pin pushes Steng out of the way, saving him. Steng grins his thanks -- then suddenly slashes at Pintel who jumps back.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Hey! You're a pirate! Steng slashes, Pintel falls backwards over a rail -- Elizabeth and Barbossa, Cotton and Marty take on an array East India Trading Company AGENTS -- Agents crouch behind the push-cart of Tia Dalma. The cana away from it, through open doors of their cages. The Agen something is wrong, and run -- Just as the cart EXPLODES -- ON A PLATFORM, a wall collapses and Mercer is knocked bac the shadows. He pulls a steel chopstick out of one should then the other. Looks up and sees -- Will comes around a bamboo scrim -- where Sao Feng grabs him. He puts a knife to Will's throat. Fighting, gunfire explosions can be seen past them, through the scrim.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: Odd coincidence, isn't it? The East India Trading Company finds me the day you show up in Singapore.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: It is coincidence only. Will twists away, flashes his own knife; Sao Feng blocks Mercer, unseen, grins and draws his pistol, aims --

dialogues.speaker: WILL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You want to cut a deal with Beckett? You need what I offer. ON MERCER, ready to fire -- but hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: You crossed Barbossa, you're willing to cross Jack Sparrow -- why should I expect any better?  536 537 538 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 14.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: They are in the way of what I want. You're helping me get it. Sao Feng accepts this logic, but has a final point:

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: You betray me, and I will slit your throat.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Then we have an understanding. They each lower their knives. Sao Feng hands Will the cha ON THE DOCKS, Jack the Monkey lights a rocket. The rocket across the water, into the fireworks shed. EXPLOSIONS, an shed TILTS OVER, SPLASHES -- ON THE PLATFORMS, Barbossa and Elizabeth arrive, see Will the charts, standing with Tai Huang.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: You have the charts!

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: And better. (indicates Huang) A ship and a crew.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Where's Sao Feng?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: He will cover our escape -- then meet us at Shipwreck Cove.

dialogues.speaker: HUANG
dialogues.text: This way. Be quick. Barbossa nods; he and Will follow Tai Huang away, followe by Elizabeth, Pintel, Ragetti, Cotton. ON MERCER, still h . he recedes back into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chinese Junk sails out of the harbor. The night sky G from FIRES burning in Singapore. Barbossa confronts Will.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: You weren't supposed to get caught.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: It worked out the way I wanted.  539 540 541 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 15. He moves away -- past, Elizabeth who looks out from the r there are dozens of ships clustered on shore. Beyond them the glow of Singapore as it burns.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: There's no place left for him to cower. Do you think he will honor the call? Tia Dalma steps up behind her

dialogues.speaker: TIA DALMA
dialogues.text: I cannot say. There be something on the seas that even the most staunch and bloodthirsty pirates have come to fear --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dutchman SURFACES. CANNON PORTS open. CANNONS FIRE -- rapid, no time for reloading -- PIRATES SHIPS are hit BROADSIDES. Their cannons return fire. The Dutchman's cannons go silent. Smoke drifts from the barrels, becoming ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . smoke that the Flying Dutchman sails through regally, smoke issuing from burning wreckage. It sails past, revea IN THE DISTANCE, the Endeavour rides majestic on the hori

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAP of the world; ship models representing squadrons. Several officers pore over it. A PIECE OF EIGHT spins on a desktop; a hand slams down on it: Beckett's. He picks it up, examines it. The Dead Man' Chest is on the desk as well.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: A piece of eight. Nine of them, you said?

dialogues.speaker: MERCER
dialogues.text: Our new friend in Singapore was very specific, sir: nine pieces of eight.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: What is the significance of that, I wonder?  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 16.

dialogues.speaker: MERCER
dialogues.text: Does it matter? There's nothing can hold against the armada, (taps fingers on chest) not with the Flying Dutchman at the lead.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: Nothing we know of. Did our friend happen to mention where the Brethren Court is meeting?

dialogues.speaker: MERCER
dialogues.text: He was mum on that, sir.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: Then he understand the value of information. Speaking of ... best keep all this to ourselves. He glances across the room, where SWANN sits at a table, signing orders, one after another.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We can't have anyone running off to Singapore, can we? Ah, Admiral! Now-Admiral NORRINGTON has entered the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: NORRINGTON
dialogues.text: You summoned me, Lord Beckett?

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: Yes. Something there that better suits your new station. He nods to a long wooden box on a sideboard. Norrington t he recognizes it, opens it. Inside is his SWORD. A glance back at Beckett, who nods. Norrington lifts the sword, considering what it means.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Brethren know they face extinction. All that's left is for them to decide where they will make their final stand. ON SWANN - a clerk sets a sheaf of documents before him.

dialogues.speaker: SWANN
dialogues.text: Not more requisition orders.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: No, sir. Execution.  542 543 544 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 17. Swann is distressed by that; briefly, he makes eye contac with Norrington. Both men quickly look away. Swann picks his quill, resumes his distasteful task GROVES enters, salutes Beckett.

dialogues.speaker: GROVES
dialogues.text: The attack is ended, sir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Governor Swann stares out at sections of blasted hull, floating barrels, and bodies. Beckett and Norrington arri gaze out at the carnage.

dialogues.speaker: NORRINGTON
dialogues.text: Appalling. Beckett raises his spyglass.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: Bloody hell. There's nothing left. (to Norrington) Prepare to lower the boat. Fetch the chest. Swann wants to turn away, but forces himself to look --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music plays. Jones gazes at the locket with the picture o hanging from the pipe organ. He lifts it gently ... A tear forms in his eye. Jones touches a knuckle to the t and is stunned by its presence, by his own emotions. He k the cause, glances toward the deck --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dead Man's Chest is brought over the rail, guarded by MARINES, including MURTOGG and MULLROY, and led by Norrin Norrington takes in the ship, the crewmen, not happy to b there. He notes the fear in his men.

dialogues.speaker: NORRINGTON
dialogues.text: Steady, men. We stand aboard a seagoing vessel, no more and no less. You will comport yourself as marines. Murtogg puts a hand on a rail, snatches it back, disguste

dialogues.speaker: MULLROY
dialogues.text: Oh, now, it's not all that bad. A little bit of elbow grease, is all she needs.  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 18.

dialogues.speaker: MURTOGG
dialogues.text: We set the grease on fire?

dialogues.speaker: MULLROY
dialogues.text: And get away as fast as we can.

dialogues.speaker: MURTOGG
dialogues.text: It's a two-part plan.

dialogues.speaker: MULLROY
dialogues.text: That's how you know it's a good one. Jones strides up, but keeps his distance from the chest.

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: Go, the lot of you -- and take that with you! I will not have that infernal thing on my ship!

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: Oh. I'm sorry to hear that. Because I will. Because it seems to be the only way to ensure this ship do as directed by the Company. Jones grips the ship's rail with his claw. Beckett nods, indicates Norrington should continue away with the chest.

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: The Dutchman sails as its Captain commands.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: And the Captain is to sail it as commanded. This is no longer your world, Jones. The immaterial has become ... immaterial. I would have thought you'd learned that when I ordered you to kill your pet. Swann steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: SWANN
dialogues.text: Did you give those ships opportunity to surrender?

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: We let them see us. Methinks that opportunity enough.

dialogues.speaker: SWANN
dialogues.text: My daughter could have been aboard one of them! That alone is cause to exercise restraint!  545 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 19.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: We need prisoners to interrogate. Which works best when they are alive.

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: I am exterminating pirates. As commanded by the Company. (to Swann) And your daughter is dead. Pulled under with the Black Pearl -- by my pet. Did Lord Beckett not tell you that? Swann is taken aback with shock -- then whirls and runs f the cabin. Beckett gives Jones a dark look, follows --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chest is set in place. The key inserted into the lock Norrington. He opens the chest; the BEATING HEART is insi Swann comes into the cabin, purposeful. The MARINES immediately point their rifles at the heart. Swann grabs of their bayonets, intending to plunge it into the heart Norrington grabs his wrist.

dialogues.speaker: NORRINGTON
dialogues.text: Governor!

dialogues.speaker: SWANN
dialogues.text: Did you know? Did you? He doesn't know what he's talking about.

dialogues.speaker: SWANN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She's dead! Elizabeth is dead! Norrington is stunned. Swann breaks down. Norrington jerk his head to the marines: leave. They do. Swann regains his purpose --

dialogues.speaker: SWANN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let me go! Let me do this!

dialogues.speaker: JONES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Let him go. Jones is in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: SWANN
dialogues.text: Stay back! I will kill you!  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 20.

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: And are you prepared for what comes after? When I carved that traitorous vessel from my body, I cast upon it a terrible geis. If you stab my heart . then yours will take its place. The import of that is not lost on Swann and Norrington.

dialogues.speaker: JONES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The crew is not bound to me, they are bound to the Dutchman ... and the Dutchman must have a captain. Will ye serve? Swann hesitates -- Beckett and Mercer arrived in time to hear the end of Jones' speech. Beckett is none too please

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: Governor! Your daughter is still alive.

dialogues.speaker: MERCER
dialogues.text: Saw her myself, in Singapore. That's news to Jones; he snaps an angry look at Beckett. Beckett waves him off.

dialogues.speaker: SWANN
dialogues.text: You're all liars!

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: No. Jones is merely cruel. But perhaps I am guilty of sin by omission. For which I apologize.

dialogues.speaker: NORRINGTON
dialogues.text: Governor ... Weatherby ... there's still hope. Swann searches his face -- he, at least, is sincere.

dialogues.speaker: NORRINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have hope. The anger drains from Swann's face. He releases the bayon to Norrington. To Beckett:

dialogues.speaker: SWANN
dialogues.text: Our association is ended. Norrington escorts him out, past Beckett -- he gives Beck a narrow look: he does not like what he just heard.  546 547 548 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 21.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: You're dismissed, Captain. Jones gives him the same narrow look, exits. Beckett contemplates his options as he shuts the chest softly.

dialogues.speaker: MERCER
dialogues.text: He's a sly one, that Jones. Who's going to kill him, if they become him? Beckett considers that; not good.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: I can order Admiral Norrington's silence. He'll obey; it's what he does.

dialogues.speaker: MERCER
dialogues.text: And the governor? Beckett considers; he is genuinely regretful.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: Yes. Well. Every man should have a secret he carries to his grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will makes a line fast -- notices a speck of water on the back of his hand. Looks up -- Many SNOWFLAKES are falling down onto the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hai Peng sails into a frozen glacial landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monkey, shivering. Ragetti, shivering. Pintel, shiver Tia Dalma stands nearby, not shivering.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: No one said anything about cold.

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: I'm sure there's good reason for us suffering.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Why didn't the obeah woman just bring back Jack the way she brought back Barbossa?  549 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 22.

dialogues.speaker: TIA DALMA
dialogues.text: Because Barbossa was only dead. He didn't know she was standing there.

dialogues.speaker: TIA DALMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jack Sparrow be taken body and soul, to a place not of death, but punishment. The worst fate a person can conjure for himself, stretching on forever ... That's what awaits in Davy Jones' Locker. She moves away.

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: I knew there was a good reason. CLOSE ON: THE MAP, as Will moves the circles within circl the chart. In the center, a drawing of a ship rotates.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: (to Huang) Nothing here is set. It can't be as accurate as modern charts.

dialogues.speaker: HUANG
dialogues.text: No. But it leads to more places. Will stares after Huang as he moves away. Will's focus mo to one of the inscribed poems. He frowns.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: "Over the edge, back, over again, sunrise sets, flash of green." Do you care to interpret, Barbossa?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Ever gazed upon the green flash, Mister Gibbs?

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: I reckon I've seen my share. (to Will) Happens on rare occasion, at the last glimpse of sunset, a green flash shoots up into the sky. Some go their whole lives and never see it. Some claim to have seen it who ain't. Some say --

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: -- it signals when a soul comes back to this world from the dead! (Gibbs glares at him) Sorry.  550 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 23. Pintel slinks away, joins Ragetti.

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: Don't they get it? It's a riddle. Riddles are fun. "Over the edge, back, over again --"

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Riddles are not fun! The way it always goes is some poor bloke ends up dead, but just beforehand he realizes no, I wasn't supposed to listen to the sirens, I wasn't supposed to take the pot ‘gold, but by then it's too late and he dies in a horrible and ofttimes ironical manner, and in this case, you and I be the poor bloke! By the time Pintel is done with his rant, all on deck are staring at him. Barbossa grins.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: See, Mister Turner? We will finda way. It's not getting to the land of the dead is the problem -- it's getting back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth stands beneath a lantern at the rail. She stare out at the dark sea. The icebergs are gone. Will joins he The ocean before them is a mirror, stars above and below. A silence between Will and Elizabeth. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: How long do we continue not talking? In fact Elizabeth doesn't want to talk. But --

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Once we rescue Jack, everything will be fine. There are many ways to intrepret those words and Will run through them all. Finally concludes:

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Then we will rescue Jack Elizabeth nods, steps back from the rail -- turns and lea Will leans forward, arms on the rail ... and notices: Far away, a line of white mist stretches to infinity.  551 552 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 24.

dialogues.speaker: WILL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Barbossa! Ahead!

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Aye, these be the waters I know. We're good and lost now.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Lost?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: For certain you have to be lost, to find a place as can't be found. Elseways everyone would know where it was, aye? Barbossa laughs. Gibbs looks over the rail --

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: We're gaining speed ...

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: To stations! All hands! To stations! The ship gathers more speed, and the SOUND of RAGING WATE is heard.

dialogues.speaker: WILL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Rudder full! Hard a-port! Gather way and keep her trim! Pirates scramble to comply -- Barbossa strides forward.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Belay that! Let her run straight and true! Will climbs the rigging, looks out --

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Hard a-port! FROM ABOVE, we see the Hai Peng as it fights the pull of current, turning -- but not sharp enough PULL BACK AND REVEAL: an endlessly long WATERFALL where t ocean itself flows over and down into nothingness THE EDGE OF THE WORLD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tia Dalma appears on deck. Unlike those around her, she i calm and serene. She tosses her crab claws down onto a ba head. Leans over them, murmurs an INCANTATION.  553 554 555 556 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 25.

dialogues.speaker: TIA DALMA
dialogues.text: Malfaiteur en Tombeau, Crochir 1'Esplanade, Dans 1'Fond d'1' eau! She repeats the phrase, faster and then slower. Moves the claws around in an intricate, repeating pattern -- The ROAR is now DEAFENING. Will wrestles the wheel. Eliza whirls to Barbossa as he pulls himself to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: You've doomed us all.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Don't be so unkind! Ye may not survive to pass this way again -- and these be the last friendly words ye'll hear FROM ABOVE, the Hai Peng continues to turn, fighting to e . near sideways now to the edge. The hull of the Hai Peng sticks out into the air ... and then the entire ship TILTS over and TOPPLES DOWN -- Elizabeth SCREAMS ... Barbossa LAUGHS ... all the Pirates as the ship plummets down into -- BLACKNESS. And SILENCE. Then SINGING and LAUGHTER. Various pirate vo distant, eerie ... "Yo ho yo ho a pirate's life for me... And just as quickly as they came, the voices FADE ...

dialogues.speaker: FADE UP
dialogues.text: A WHITE HOT SUN burns in a cloudless blue sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loose sail flaps in the wind. The sail is pulled aside reveal CAPTAIN JACK SPARROW. He makes it fast, calls up:

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Boatswain! Haul the halyard, slacken braces! PAN UP TO -- surprise! -- JACK SPARROW, a second one, in rigging. Jack waves and calls down:

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (BOATSWAIN)
dialogues.text: Aye, Captain! Slacken braces, men make all! How does she lie? ON DECK, a sailor turns: JACK SPARROW again. 553 554 555 556  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 26.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A fair wind and a following sea! Captain Jack nods. In good spirits, he moves along the de then stops and looks down. There is a problem.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CAPTAIN)
dialogues.text: Mister Sparrow, come here.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (BOATSWAIN)
dialogues.text: Aye, Captain! Jack drops down from the rigging. Captain Jack's demeanor rigid, with a gaze that could wither Captain Bly.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CAPTAIN)
dialogues.text: What say ye about the condition of the knot on this bow line?

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (BOATSWAIN)
dialogues.text: It be proper to my eyes, sir. As he speaks, Captain Jack tugs on the line and it unrave

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CAPTAIN)
dialogues.text: Proper? It is neither proper nor suitable, sir! It is not acceptable nor adequate. It is, in obvious fact, an abomination. Another Jack steps forward -- earnest, well-meaning.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (HONEST)
dialogues.text: Begging your pardon, sir. Perhaps if you gave the man another chance --

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CAPTAIN)
dialogues.text: It's that sort of thinking that got us into this mess. Jack pulls a pistol and SHOOTS honest Jack, who goes stum backwards, over the rail. Jack turns back -- CLOSE ON Jack's face, close enough to see the spittle fly

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have caused us to lose speed and therefore time. Precious time, which cannot be recovered once lost. Do you understand? Aye, Captain. DO YOU

dialogues.speaker: NOW
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to see that there is no one speaking to Jack, a he speaks to no one. He carries both sides of the argumen Madness in his eyes.  557 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 27.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It will have to be redone. All of it. All of it! And let this serve as a lesson to the lot of you! PULL BACK MORE. We see the true state of the Black Pearl. Sails flat. No crew. No movement. No other Jack Sparrows. The Black Pearl sits alone in a vast desert. With Jack Sparrow, alone, raving on the deck

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's the doldrums, sir, it has the entire crew on edge -- Stow it! I have no sympathy for any of you feculent maggots -- (steps up onto rail) -- and no more patience to pretend otherwise! He steps off the rail -- on the wrong side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack drops down into the sand next to the Black Pearl. Pi up a rope and pulls -- his feet dig into the sand; he goe nowhere. The rope angles up behind him to the ship. He's trying to pull it, to no avail. He slumps down.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No wind. Nearby are several SMOOTH ROUND STONES. Jack picks one up and FLINGS it, skipping it across the sand. Jack sits dow Looks over. Weirdly, the stone comes rolling back. The stone rocks back and forth, an egg hatching. Cracks appear. The stone transform into a_crab. The Crab turns toward Jack. Clicks, like it's laughing.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Perfect. What would my torment be without unusual crabs here to mock me. Jack grabs a handful of sand and flings it. The crab flin back. Jack collapses. The crab scuttles forward, looks at Jack. Scuttles sidewa looks at the ship. The crab moves away to the pile of sto Jack sits with his head lowered to his knees, alone in th dunes of the vast desert.  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack lays on his back in the sand. Baking in the sun. A S MOVES OVER HIM. Jack opens his eyes, blinks. ANGLE - ABOVE JACK, the PROW of the Black Pearl. Moving. Jack stands up, sees -- the Black Pearl drifts, floats ac the sand, carried on the back of a thousand chittering cr

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hai Peng crew stumble out of the surf, bedraggled and exhausted. Pintel and Ragetti still carry the ship plank they clinged to for safety.

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: I hate boats. *

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Really? So, no more waxing all poetic * "bout how you runned away to sea and how you's only truly happiest at sea --

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: I still love the sea, it's boats * that can't be trusted. Gibbs takes in the utter desolation. *

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: This be truly a God-forsaken place.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: I don't see Jack. I don't see anyone.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Not a soul.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: He is here. Davy Jones never once gave up that what he's took

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: (at Barbossa) And does it matter? We are trapped here, by your doing. No different than Jack.

dialogues.speaker: TIA DALMA
dialogues.text: Witty Jack be closer than you think. All eyes turn to Tia Dalma. A DOZEN CRABS appear, moving over the sand, scuttling sideways up onto her.  560 561

dialogues.speaker: WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 29.
dialogues.text: She balances them on her arms, cooing to them like pets. Behind her -- JACK SPARROW APPEARS in the sky, at the bow of the Black riding over the desert sand, toward the water, carried on backs of ten thousand chittering crabs.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Slap me thrice and hand me to my momma! It's Jack! Elizabeth, Gibbs, and Will see Jack and grin -- even Barb has to smile. The ship SPLASHES down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack sloshes toward them, the Pearl behind him. Gibbs ste forward, arms wide, a grin on his face --

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (sharp) Mister Gibbs. Gibbs snaps to attention.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Aye, Captain!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I thought so. I expect you can account for your actions?

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (lost) Sir?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: There has been a perpetual and virulent lack of discipline upon my vessel! Why? Why is that?

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Sir -- you're in Davy Jones Locker

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I know that. I know where I am and don't think I don't.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Jack Sparrow. Jack freezes at the voice, turns. Crew members step back reveal: Barbossa. Jack recognizes Barbossa.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Ah ... Hector. It's been too long.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yes, Isle de Muerta, remember? You shot me!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I did not. (sees Tia Dalma) ) Tia Dalma, out and about! You add an agreeable sense of the macabre to any delirium.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: He thinks we're an hallucination?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Ah, William. Tell me, have you come because you need my help to save a certain distressing damsel? I mean, damsel in distress? (weighs it briefly) Either one.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Then you wouldn't be here, so you can't be here, Q.E.D, you're not really here.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Jack. Jack sees her for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is real. We're here. Jack looks at her steadily. Fear, mistrust, recognition a realization. He turns away. Gibbs joins him.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: The Locker you say.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Aye. Jack nods -- he gets it now.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: We've come to rescue you!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Have you now? That's a good one. Very kind of you. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee eH  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 31.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But it would seem as I possess a ship, and you don't, you're the ones in need of rescuing and I'm not sure as I'm in the mood.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: (indicates the Pearl) I see my ship, right there. Jack squints, searching, bobs up on his toes, leans side side as if he can't find Barbossa's ship.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Can't spot it. Must be a tiny little thing hiding somewhere behind the Pearl. Barbossa and Jack are about to go at it -- Will steps bet

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Jack, listen. Cutler Beckett has the heart of Davy Jones. He controls the Flying Dutchman.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: He's taking over the seas.

dialogues.speaker: TIA DALMA
dialogues.text: The song has been sung. The Brethren Court is called.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I leave you folk alone for just a minute, and look what happens.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Aye, Jack. The world needs you back something fierce.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: And you need a crew. Jack looks -- Will, Barbossa, Pintel, Elizabeth and Tia D are lined up. He steps back, goes down the line --

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Why should I sail with any of you? Four of you have tried to kill me in the past. (he gets to Elizabeth) One of you succeeded. Will is startled. Jack notices. (It's news to all of them of course.)  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 32.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She hasn't told you? Then you'll have lots to talk about while you're here. (to Tia Dalma) As for you --

dialogues.speaker: TIA DALMA
dialogues.text: Oh, don't tell me you didn't enjoy it at the time.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: That's fair. All right, you're in. (to Ragetti) I don't need you. (to Gibbs) Gibbs, you get another chance. Marty. Cotton, all right. And Cotton's Parrot, I'ma little iffy, but all right, you're a team -- Jack comes to Tai Huang.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And you are?

dialogues.speaker: HUANG
dialogues.text: Tai Huang. These are my men.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Where do your allegiances lie?

dialogues.speaker: HUANG
dialogues.text: With the highest bidder

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I have a ship.

dialogues.speaker: TAI HUANG
dialogues.text: That makes you the highest bidder. Jack, satisfied, gestures for them to get on board.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Weigh anchor! All hands! Stand by to make way! He pulls out his Compass. Glances down: the needle holds steady. Jack smiles, moves his hand -- the needle doesn't move. No matter how he fiddles, the needle is frozen in place

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ja-ack. Jack turns. Barbossa holds up the ancient charts.  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 33.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Which way you going, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbossa calls out orders. Jack shadows him, and repeats orders a half-second behind, a little louder

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Trim that sail! Slack windward brace and sheet! Haul that pennant line!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Trim that sail! Slack windward brace and sheet! Haul that pennant line!

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: The Captain gives orders on a ship.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: The Captain is giving orders.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: My ship, that makes me Captain.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: They be my charts!

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Stow it, the both of you, and that's an order! Understand? Jack and Barbossa stare at Pintel, too incredulous to res Pintel puts his hands up and backs away --

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry! Just, with the Captain issue in doubt and all, thought I'd throw my name in for consideration -- sorry.

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: I would vote for you. Jack steps up to the rail, and ceremoniously pulls out a telescope, the way a Captain would do it. Barbossa steps up beside him. Smirks ... pulls out a MUCH LONGER telescope. Jack stares at it, deflated. Will steps past them, searching the deck for Elizabeth --  563 564 565 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks, finds Elizabeth, sitting alone.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: You left Jack to the Kraken. She looks up. She's been crying -- but she is relieved.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: He's rescued now. It's done with. Will does not agree. Looks away. She stands --

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Will, I had no choice!

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: You chose not to tell me.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: I couldn't. It wasn't your burden to bear. He catches her arm, pulls her around to face him.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: But I did bear it. Didn't I? I just didn't know what it was. I thought

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: You thought I loved him. She tries to move past him. He blocks her way. She tries push him aside. He pushes her back, against the hull.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: If you make your choices alone, how can I trust you? She meets his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: You can't. He looks away from her. She ducks beneath his arm and goe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sailing the darkness between worlds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cabin is still ripped to shreds from the encounter wi the Flying Dutchman, the Kraken. Barbossa inspects the da  566 567 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 35.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: I see you neglected to care for my ship.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What, this? Just ventilating. Clear out the stench of the previous owner you know. Thinking of putting in French doors, actually. Feel the cross breeze? Gibbs sticks his head in.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Heading, Captain? On the word 'Captain' both Jack and Barbossa turn.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Two degrees starboard --

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: I'm Captain of the starboard side! Two degrees starboard. The Captain will now take the helm.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: (salutes twice) Aye, Sirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs exits, followed by Jack and Barbossa. Each of them split to opposite stairs, Jack to port, Barbossa starboar They come together at the wheel, with a nervous Cotton in between. Jack adjusts the wheel. Barbossa adjusts it back ON THE STERN DECK, Ragetti surreptitiously readies a fish pole. Moves to the railing, looks down. Drops the line -- IN THE WATER, a pale BODY hurries past, face up, eyes clo hands crossed over its chest. Ragetti lets out a cry, jum back. He edges back to the rail -- A STREAM of BODIES flows past underwater. Old, young, men and women, at different depths and moving at different sp Pintel has joined Ragetti, watching over the side.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Eerie. Downright macabre.  568 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 36.

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: (musing) I wonder what would happen if you dropped a cannonball on one of ‘em. They look at each other -- let's find out! Pintel picks up a cannonball, turns -- Tia Dalma is there fixes them both with stern look. Frightened, Pintel drops the cannon ball.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Be disrespectful, it would.

dialogues.speaker: TIA DALMA
dialogues.text: (looks out to sea) They should be in the care of Davy Jones. That was the duty he was charged with by the goddess Calypso: to ferry those who died at sea to the other side. And every ten years, he could come ashore, to be with she who loved him truly. But he has become a monster.

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: He wasn't always all tentacle-y?

dialogues.speaker: TIA DALMA
dialogues.text: No, he was a man, once. Poor unfortunate souls ... now they must find their own way. Ragetti nods, spots something ahead: a small boat, coming toward them, lit by a lantern's glow.

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: Now it's boats coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will and Elizabeth join Tia Dalma at the rail. Far away other boats can be seen, their own lanterns lit. Gibbs arrives at the rail, loading a rifle, lifts it to a Will stops him.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: No. They are not a threat to us. Am I right? He looks to Tia Dalma for confirmation.

dialogues.speaker: TIA DALMA
dialogues.text: We are but ghosts to them. They heed us not.  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 37.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Best just let them be. Gibbs lowers the rifle but keeps it ready. The boats move past, an eerie, surreal sight. Elizabeth looks at the nea boat, peers closer. Recognizes the passenger

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: My father! We've made it back (to Swann) Father, here! Look here! Jack puts a consoling hand on Elizabeth's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Elizabeth. We're not back yet. He looks her in the eye. Elizabeth stares at him -- and realization dawns. Her next cry is one of anguish:

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Father! IN THE BOAT, Weatherby Swann glances over. His lantern li half his face, leaving the rest in shadow.

dialogues.speaker: SWANN
dialogues.text: Elizabeth! (concern) Are you dead?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: No ... Swann nods at that. Elizabeth has to move along the rail the Pearl, toward the stern, to keep pace with him.

dialogues.speaker: SWANN
dialogues.text: I think I am.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: No. You can't be.

dialogues.speaker: SWANN
dialogues.text: (has trouble recalling) There was a chest, you see ... How odd. At the time, it seemed so important.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Come abroad! (to the others) ) Someone -- cast a line! (to Swann) Come back with us!  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 38. Crewmen prepare a line, too slowly for Elizabeth. She gra it from them, casts it out. It lands neatly in Swann's bo but he makes no move toward it.

dialogues.speaker: SWANN
dialogues.text: And a heart, and if you stabbed the heart ... you would have to sail forever. That's how it worked. Stab the heart and take his place. The Dutchman must have a Captain. Silly thing to die for. Will makes note of that. Jack makes note as well. Glances Tia Dalma. But Tia Dalma is focused only on Will. She whispers, just loud enough for Will to hear --

dialogues.speaker: TIA DALMA
dialogues.text: A touch of destiny ... Due to the action of the two vessels passing, the rope be to slip toward the edge of the boat.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Take the line!

dialogues.speaker: SWANN
dialogues.text: (suddenly; this is important) Elizabeth. She gives him her full attention.

dialogues.speaker: SWANN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When I would reprimand you to obey rules, it was because I did not want you to ever be unhappy. But I should have recognized in your willfulness ... your courage. I am proud of you Elizabeth. The line is about to slip from Swann's boat.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: The line! Catch the line! The end of the falls into the water

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Father! His boat is near the aft of the Pearl.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come back with us! Please! I won't let you go!  569 570 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 39.

dialogues.speaker: TIA DALMA
dialogues.text: She must not leave the ship! Elizabeth climbs the rail. Will get there slightly ahead Jack to haul her back.

dialogues.speaker: SWANN
dialogues.text: I'll give your love to your mother, then, shall I? Elizabeth stares after him. Watching, helpless. Light of the boat's lantern is swallowed up by the darkne Elizabeth turns toward Will, into his arms. He confronts . but his eyes drift toward Tia Dalma.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Is there a way?

dialogues.speaker: TIA DALMA
dialogues.text: (shakes her head 'no') He is at peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An orange sun hovers over a dark horizon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wind. No movement. The crew lays about the deck -- par with thirst, no energy. Pintel tilts a water barrel over head, cracked lips waiting, waiting -- nothing.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: No water. Why is all but the rum gone? Gibbs lets a final drop fall from a bottle to his lips --

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Rum's gone too. Tia Dalma and Will are at the rail. Elizabeth sits alone withdrawn. Will watches her.

dialogues.speaker: TIA DALMA
dialogues.text: If we can not escape these doldrums before night, I fear we will sail on trackless seas, under starless skies, doomed to roam the reach between worlds ... forever.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: With no water, forever looks to be arriving a mite soon.  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 40. Ragetti, hand over his eye, chases the Monkey past. Jack notices Ragetti's eye as it rolls on top of the Charts.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: (re: Barbossa) Why doesn't he do something? (reads) "Over the edge, back, over again, sunrise sets, flash of green." ON JACK: gazing at the chart, where rolls Ragetti's eye.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: There's no sense to it. Sunrises don't set.

dialogues.speaker: WILL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: And the green flash happens at sunset not sunrise.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Over the edge ... driving me bloody well over the edge. They fade into the background as Jack watches Ragetti's e rolling back and forth, idly plays with the rings of the charts. Chinese characters line up to read: UP IS DOWN.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Up is down. That's maddeningly unhelpful. Why are these things never clear? 571 CLOSE ON: Jack's hair, a JUNGLE of GIANT DREADLOCKS, Jack-on-Jack's-shoulder pushes through.

dialogues.speaker: JACK LEFT
dialogues.text: Stab the heart. Jack jumps, shocked and unsettled..

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What? A second small Jack is on Jack's right shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JACK RIGHT
dialogues.text: Don't stab the heart.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Come again?

dialogues.speaker: JACK RIGHT
dialogues.text: The Dutchman must have a Captain. 571  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 41.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: That's even more than less than unhelpful.

dialogues.speaker: JACK LEFT
dialogues.text: Sail the seas for eternity.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I love the sea.

dialogues.speaker: JACK LEFT
dialogues.text: But what about port?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I prefer rum. Rum's good.

dialogues.speaker: JACK LEFT
dialogues.text: Making port.

dialogues.speaker: JACK RIGHT
dialogues.text: Where we can get rum. And salty wenches. Once every ten years.

dialogues.speaker: JACK LEFT
dialogues.text: What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Once every ten years.

dialogues.speaker: JACK LEFT
dialogues.text: Ten years is a long time.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Even longer, given the deficit of rum.

dialogues.speaker: JACK RIGHT
dialogues.text: And salty wenches.

dialogues.speaker: JACK LEFT
dialogues.text: But eternity is longer still.

dialogues.speaker: JACK RIGHT
dialogues.text: (to Jack) And how will you spend it? Dead, or not?

dialogues.speaker: JACK LEFT
dialogues.text: The immortal Captain Jack Sparrow ..

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Oooh I like that.

dialogues.speaker: JACK RIGHT
dialogues.text: Come sunset, it won't matter.  572 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 42. ON THE MAP, as Jack notices: as the drawing of the ship s upside down, RAYS OF a SUNSET are created. And Jack KNOWS

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Not sun-set. Sun-down. And rise . up! He stands. Points.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Over there! What's that? I don't know! What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Where? Jack moves over to the railing at port. Everyone follows the ship tilts that way a little. Jack turns, suddenly ra to the starboard side.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: There, it moved! Suddenly. It's very fast. Everyone follows -- what is he up to? The ship tilts that way some; the eyeball rolls. Elizabeth can't help but not the activity. Jack suddenly seems to see something on back the port sid

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thar! Over thar He runs to port. Elizabeth follows everyone else to the r The ship rocks back.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It's not here! He runs across again, everyone follows, and the ship tilt more. Barbossa approaches the map -- sees UP IS DOWN, the upside down ship, the sunset. Picks up the rolling eye. A glare at Ragetti -- and Barbossa hands back the eye, go back to studying the chart.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: He's rocking the ship.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: (running past) We're rocking the ship!  573 574 575 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 43. And, suddenly, Barbossa gets it:

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Aye, he's onto it. All hands together Time it with the swell! Barbossa moves to the hold --

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Loose the cannon! Unstow the cargo! Let it shift! Cargo is cut loose; crates, bottles, barrels roll --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotton spins the wheel -- FROM ABOVE, the ship turns sideways to the swell. The shi tilts over. Pintel suddenly figure it out --

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: He's rocking the ship! Ragetti already has a rope ready.

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: We tie each other to the mast, upside down, so we'll be right side up when the boat flips! Pintel thinks about it. Thinks about it. Thinks about it Will gets to the rail as the ship tilts near horizontal, looks out. The sun SINKS into the sea, a small orange fla left -- the Black Pearl tilts the other way --

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: And now up, is down! The Black Pearl rocks completely over into the water. Wav fill the sails and cause the ship to continue to roll --

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA MOVES AROUND THE ROLLING SHIP, PAST THE SURFACE --
dialogues.text: UNDERWATER, chains, cannons, small objects fall down towa the depths. Jack, Will, Elizabeth, Barbossa hold on. Gibb loses his grip, floats past -- Marty grabs him. Pintel an Ragetti, tied to the mast, look at each other, hold their breaths, cheeks bulging. Underwater, the Charts float past -- Will grabs them --

dialogues.speaker: -- CAMERA SPINS, SO THE BLACK PEARL IS RIGHT SIDE UP --
dialogues.text: 573 574 575  576 577 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 44. ON THE HORIZON, the FLASH OF GREEN shoots up! 576

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of the water FALLS with a giant SPLASH. The objects f people fall, the parrot falls, SLAMMING onto the deck. Th water washes away, and the Black Pearl bobs on the sea. Gibbs still holds his breath, unsure, turning red ... fin has to let it out. Takes a deep breath --

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Blessed sweet Westerlies! We're back He wets his finger, lifts it. Jack opens his fist, forces himself to look -- no black s Pintel and Ragetti hang upside down, tied to the mast.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: This was your idea, and the fact that I went along does not make you any less stupid.

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: Well it don't make you no more smart, neither.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Yes it does, my lack of instigating stupid ideas makes me smarter by omission. Next to Pintel's head, Cotton's parrot shakes off water a ruffles its feathers. Elizabeth gazes at the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: It's a sunrise. Will looks out and sees the sun rising above the water. A brief moment of celebration as everyone grins at each oth Then EVERYBODY instantly draws their pistols at once, and points them at each other -- Will at Barbossa. Barbossa at Jack. Gibbs at Barbossa. Elizabeth at Jack. Jack at Will, draws a second pistol, at Barbossa. Barboss draws a second pistol, at Gibbs. Elizabeth picks up a sec pistol, points it at Barbossa.  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 45. It's a moment everyone has been preparing for. A beat -- And then EVERYBODY LAUGHS. They can't help but grin, lowe their pistols. Suddenly the LAUGHTER STOPS and the pistol are raised again. Pintel and Ragetti work to get free.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Get untied, we need our pistols! Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: Who would we point at?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: All right, then. The Brethren Court is a-gathering at Shipwreck Cove. Jack, you and I be going there, and there's no arguing the point.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I is arguing the point. If there's pirates a-gathering, I'm a-pointing my ship the other a-way.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: The pirates are gathering to fight Beckett. And you're a pirate. She swings her second pistol toward Jack. Jack stops aimi at Will, aims at her. Will aims at Jack, draws a second p to cover Barbossa.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Fight or not, you're not running.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: If we don't stand together, they'll hunt us down, one by one, 'til there's none left but you.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Then I’1l be the last pirate. At least then there will be only one of me.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Aye, and you'll be fighting Jones alone. How does that figure into your plans?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Still working on it. But I'm not going back to the Locker, Barbossa. Count on that.  578 579 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 46. Jack fires his pistol -- 'click.' Barbossa and Will and Elizabeth fire -- more 'clicks.' Pintel and Ragetti arriv with their pistols as the others check their own.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Wet powder.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: We've other issues to deal with. We can get back to shooting each other later. They move away. Pintel and Ragetti test their own pistols click.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Wait. We can still use 'em as clubs! He demonstrates, using the pistol to hammer the air. Rage does the same -- but actually hits Pintel.

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: Sorry. (regards pistol-club) Effective, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will indicates on the chart to Jack and Barbossa.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: There's a fresh water spring on this island, where we can resupply.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You lead the shore party. I'll stay with the ship.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: I'll not be leaving my ship in your command.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: And he'll not be leaving his ship in your command, and here's an an idea. You both go, and leave the ship in my command. (off their looks) Temporarily. Promise.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE RAIL 579
dialogues.text: Barbossa steps up, pulls out his telescope. Jack arrives next to him.  580 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 47.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: An uneasy alliance? Barbossa opens his scope, looks through.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: An unholy one. Jack opens his own telescope, until it is long as Barboss . then opens it further, until it is much longer. It droo at the end. Barbossa looks at him. He smiles. Barbossa sn his telescope closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pintel and Ragetti crawl out of the surf as the other boa land. Jack and Barbossa step onto the sand, spot somethin The rest of the pirates see it, too.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Criminey! Jack and Barbossa walk toward it. Pintel and Ragetti hust past them toward -- The KRAKEN. It lies dead on the shore. Pintel finds a driftwood stick, pokes it.

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: Careful!

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Ahh, not so tough now, are you? Stupid fish! Serves you right! Jack approaches the Kraken almost reverently.

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: Hello! I bet folk would pay a shilling to see this! And a second shilling for a sketch of 'em sitting atop!

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Kraken slayers! We could carve mini'ture Krakens out of coconut and sell those, too! We could give 'ema slice as a souvenir.

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: Or fried! For lunch.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: I wonder which of the parts is edible? Jack stares into the huge eye of the beast, his image reflected back. Barbossa appears behind him.  581 582 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 48.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Still thinking of running, Jack? Think you can outrun the world? The problem of being the last of anything: by and by, there be none left at all.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Sometimes things come back. We're living proof, mate.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Aye, but that's a gamble with long odds, ain't it? There's no guarantee of coming back. But passing on -- that's dead certain. Jack contemplates that one. Barbossa regards the beast.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The world used to be a bigger place.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It's still the same size. There's just less in it. (reluctant) Summoning the Brethren Court, is it?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Our only hope.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: That's sad commentary, in and of itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty stoops to drink -- jumps back with a shout. A BODY lies dead in the water, face down. Barbossa samples a han of water, spits it out.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Poisoned. Fouled by the body. The body is turned over -- Steng, the betrayer in Singapo The wooden fid has been driven through his eye.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Hey, I know him! There's a SHOUT from outside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They rush outside. Ragetti yells something, but words are lost. He points --  583 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 49. OUT PAST THE REEF floats the Black Pearl -- and next to i a Chinese fighting ship, the EMPRESS. Jack and Barbossa stare. There is a loud CLICK! Their eye go sideways to find -- Tai Huang holds a pistol on them, backed by his men.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (points) He's the Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The landing party climbs on deck. CHINESE PIRATES -- too many to fight -- have taken over the Pearl. They've strip the crew of their weapons, shackled them together Elizabeth is held by TWO GUARDS. One of them rubs a swell eye, the other has a bloody lip. Jack and Barbossa spot Sao Feng at the same time. Jack recognizes him, and tries to be inconspicuous behind Barb

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Sao Feng. You showing up here, 'tis truly a remarkable coincidence.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: Fortune smiles upon those prepared to meet its gaze. (moves toward Jack) Jack Sparrow. You paid me great insult, once. He SLUGS Jack in the jaw. Jack staggers, his knees buckle but he keeps his feet. Holds up a hand to Sao Feng to wai searches for his hat. Finds, sets it back on his head.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: So now we can call it square.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: Hardly. Will strides up -- he spots Elizabeth in chains --

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: She's not part of the bargain. Release her.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: And what bargain be that?  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 50.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: (to his men) You heard Captain Turner. Release her.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Captain Turner?

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Aye, the perfidious rotter leda mutiny against us.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It's always the quiet ones. Elizabeth, unchained now, eyes Will warily.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me you were planning this?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: It was my burden to bear.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: The only way a pirate can make a profit, these days, is by betraying other pirates.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: I can live with that ... as long as I am not the other pirates.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: But you've no acrimony toward mutineers?

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: He did not mutiny against me, did he?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: I need the Pearl. That's the only reason I came on this voyage.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: He needs the Pearl -- (to Elizabeth) -- and you felt guilty -- (to Barbossa) -- and you and your Brethren Court . Didn't anyone come to save me just because they missed me? Gibbs, Marty and Cotton raise their hands -- Pintel and Ragetti see, and follow their lead.  584 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 51.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (points) I'm standing over there with them. Sao Feng grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Jack, but there's an old friend who wants to see you first.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I'm not certain I can survive any more visits from old friends.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: Here is our chance to find out. He nods his head toward a spot over Jack's shoulder -- Rounding the island is the ENDEAVOUR. Jack is yanked roug away by Sao Feng's men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack has been escorted into the room. Beckett signals his guards to leave without turning. He stands at the window, peering out at the Black Pearl. Jack's effects are on the table -- including the Compass. So is a decanter and two glasses of Sherry. Jack searches the room surreptitiously under the following:

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: Remarkable. The last I saw of that ship, she was on fire, a blackened hulk sinking beneath the waves.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Thank you for that memory.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: We had a deal. I contracted you to deliver cargo on my behalf. You chose to liberate it. Jack glances toward his right wrist.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: People aren't cargo, mate.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: And you incurred a heavy debt to raise her back up, didn't you? It's not here, Jack.  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 52. He turns. Jack assumes an air of questioning innocence.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What is not?

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: The heart of Davy Jones. Is safely aboard the Flying Dutchman, and so unavailable for use as leverage to satisfy your debt to the good captain. Jack clocks that.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: By my reckoning, that account's been settled.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: By your death. And, yet, here you are.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Close your eyes and pretend it's all a bad dream. That's how I get by. Beckett's control lapses momentarily; he says something h wanted to say for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: Your good deed cost me much, Jack!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: And you spared me any possibility of ending up as anything other than what I am. And for that, I thank you. He picks up a couple of the model ships from the table, pretends to "sail" them.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Will someone be in soon to draw you a bath? Beckett takes them from Jack, puts them back in their pla

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
