dialogues.text: It would be nice if all of us could be on holiday year ‘round, but someone must ensure that the world turns properly. (looking over his "world") People are what they love, Jack, and what they love is cargo. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They love spices, and linens, silks plantains ... and as long as it arrives on time and in sufficient supply, they are content to be nothing more than figures in a ledger. You're a smart man; you know I'm right.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: If you're offering me a seat on the board, I am neither depraved enough nor drunk enough to accept. Beckett hands one of the GLASSES of sherry to Jack, who's bit surprised. Beckett toasts him.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: Then perhaps you'll consider a different arrangement. One that requires nothing from you but information. Jack has spotted the Pieces of Eight on Beckett's desk.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Regarding the Brethren Court, no doubt. In exchange for fair compensation? Square my debt with Jones, guarantee my freedom?

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: Of course. It's just good business.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Were I in a divulgatory mood, what might I divulge?

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: Everything. Where are they meeting? Who are the Pirate Lords? What is the purpose of the nine pieces of eight?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I think I'd prefer to maintain my monopoly on those answers. It's just good business.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: You haven't changed. Enjoy the gallows.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I've been. Once you've taken in the view, there's not much else to it. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 585 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 54.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now, far be it for me to give advice to you, but if I were me and you were you and we each had the same lack of trust in the other, imagine you are me. You would propose that rather than you telling me where the Brethren Court is meeting, you lead me there instead, whereupon you could serve up to me the Pirate Lords, the Nine Pieces of Eight, and the whole of the Brethren Court on a silver platter. And you being me, I would likely accept such an offer.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: On a silver platter?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: With a frilly linen napkin and a spicy banana on the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sao Feng's men guard Barbossa, Will, Elizabeth and the re of Barbossa's crew. They all wear shackles. Mercer and a crew of sailors fan out on the ship. The sai begin preparations to sail. One tries to take the wheel f Huang. Sao Feng and Will intercept Mercer

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: My men are crew enough.

dialogues.speaker: MERCER
dialogues.text: Company ship, company crew.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: (to Sao Feng) You agreed, the Black Pearl was to be mine.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: And so it was. Sao Feng gestures. One of his men punches Will from behin in the kidneys, knocking the wind of out of him. Two othe shackle his arms. Will is hauled away. Sao Feng turns to Mercer.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Beckett agreed, the Black Pearl was to be mine.  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 55.

dialogues.speaker: MERCER
dialogues.text: And so it was. (smiles) Lord Beckett wouldn't give up the one ship as might prove a match for the Dutchman, would he? Sao Feng looks around. The sailors outnumber his men, and all are armed, watching for trouble. Sao Feng nods sharpl to his man at the wheel -- he steps aside for the sailor Mercer gives Sao Feng a half-salute and ambles away. Barb sidles up next to Sao Feng.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Shame they're not bound to honor the Code of the Brethren. Isn't it? Of course, honor's a hard thing to come by, nowadays.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: There is no honor to remaining with the losing side. Leaving it for the winning side ... that's just good business.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: The losing side, says you.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: They have the Dutchman. And what do the Brethren have? He sees Sao Feng is considering his words. He leans close

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: We have ... Calypso. Soa Feng is surprised; unbidden, his eyes cut toward Eliz Barbossa clocks it -- then Sao Feng adopts a skeptical me

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: Calypso. An old legend.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: No, the goddess herself, bound in human form ... fury or favor, you not be knowing ... but when the mood strikes her, and its her favor she bestows upon a lucky sailor ... well, you've heard: legendary. Barbossa and Sao Feng exchange knowing smirks.  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 56.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There was a time when the seas be untamed, the world a rougher place, and a sailor made his own fate. (beat) I aim to bring it back. And for that, I need the Brethren Court. Barbossa taps the knot pendant Sao Feng wears.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All the court.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: What are you proposing?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: What be you accepting?

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: The girl.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: We give you Elizabeth in exchange for helping us escape? Sao Feng nods -- it seems a reasonable price to him.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: No. No. Out of the question.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: It was not a question. Elizabeth has been thinking it through.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Done.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: What? (to Sao Feng) Not done.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: You've put us in these straits. If this frees us, then ... (again, to Sao Feng) Done.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: No.  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 57.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: My choice. My choice alone.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Elizabeth, they are pirates.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: I've had more than enough experience dealing with pirates. She says it pointedly, imply she's had more than enough o dealing with one pirate in particular: him.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: I am pleased -- He reaches out to take her arm, but she yanks it out of h grasp, holds up a warning finger: ah-ah

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My apologies. I know I must earn your favor. Elizabeth is a bit surprised by his respect, but she's wi to take it.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: That's right. You do.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Then we have an accord?

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: Agreed. They shake.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Now if we only had a plan.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You can keep Barbossa. The belligerent homunculus and his friend with the wooden eye, both. And Turner. Especially Turner. If he were twins you could have all three of ‘em. Beckett notes that, suspicion behind his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: And what becomes of Miss Swann?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What interest is she to you?  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 58. Beckett gives Jack a knowing smile.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The rest go with me aboard the Pearl, and I will lead you to Shipwreck Cove. A fair deal, don't you think? Jack extends his hand. Beckett smiles at it.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: Jack, I just recalled: I have this wonderful Compass that points to whatever I want. So for what do I need you?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Points to the thing you want most And that's not the Brethren Court is it?

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: No? Then what is, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Me. (long beat) Dead. He gestures to the compass: try it. Beckett opens the com From his reaction, it points to Jack. Jack scuttles sidew From Beckett's reaction, the needle follows him.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: Damn. He flings the compass to Jack. Then realizes:

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Although, it occurs: if I got what I wanted most, then wouldn't what I wanted second most become the thing I wanted most? If I killed you, I can find ... Shipwreck Cove, was it? On my own. Cut out the middleman, as it were ... literally.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: With me killed, then you'll arrive at the Cove, find it's a stronghold, nigh impregnable, able to withstand blockade for years, and you'll be wishing, oh, if only there was someone who you had not killed inside to ensure that the pirates come outside.  587 588 589 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 59.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: And you can accomplish this?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You may kill me, but you may never insult me. Who am I? (beat) I'm Captain Jack Sparrow, mate. Do we have an accord? He nods, indicating his still-extended hand. Beckett hesi THE SHIP IS ROCKED BY CANNON FIRE. Beckett falls forward. Jack grabs his hand, shakes it --

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Done! -- scoops up his effects and heads for the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack appears on deck, Beckett trailing. BODIES are litter the aftermath of fighting. Beckett looks out -- the Empre sails off, already distant. CANNON FIRE and GUNSHOTS from the Black Pearl -- ON THE BLACK PEARL, the last of Beckett's men are cut dow is driven back, somersaults off the stern -- -- SPLASHES into the water. ON THE ENDEAVOUR - Jack stares at the Pearl. Searches for across. He shoves a GUNNER away from a cannon, kicks away brace, flips the cannon over, facing into the ship. Beckett turns, looks -- Jack wraps a rope around the cann wheel, a burning fuse lighter in hand.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: You're mad.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Oh thank goodness. Because if I am in fact not living some wretched fever dream, I doubt this will work. Jack lights the cannon -- Beckett dives out of the way as FIRES -- the ball hits the mast behind him, cracking it. RECOIL shoves the cannon violently back; it SMASHES throu the rail -- and PLUMMETS -- Jack hangs on as the rope pulls him upwards and out, flyi across --  590 591 592 593 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbossa follow's Jack's trajectory. Winces at a series o HORRIBLE CRASHING SOUNDS. Pushes forward, sees: A ripped sail. Splintered barrel. Tangled rope. Spilled t and scattered gunpowder. The aftermath of what had to be terrible landing. PAN UP TO REVEAL: Jack Sparrow, standing on the aft railing, unhurt, ina relaxed pose. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Tell me you didn't miss me. Barbossa turns away in disgust. Jack hops down, comes fac to-face with Will.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Send this piss-yellow traitor to the brig. Will is dragged away -- ON THE ENDEAVOUR, OFFICER GROVES steps up to Beckett. 591

dialogues.speaker: GROVES
dialogues.text: Which ship do we follow?

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: Signal the Dutchman. We follow the Pearl -- how soon can we have the ship ready to pursue? Behind them, the broken mast cracks and FALLS, the sails plummeting. Groves stares off at the Pearl in open admira

dialogues.speaker: GROVES
dialogues.text: Do you think he plans it all out, or just makes it up as he goes along?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spectacular storm front on the horizon. The Chinese jun EMPRESS sails to avoid it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanging silks and pillows, lit by candlelight, attended b three Chinese MAIDENS. Elizabeth turns as Sao Feng enters He stares in open admiration. She is stunning in a tradit Chinese gown. Final adjustments are made by the Maidens. He recites a verse of the poem To Zhang's Dancing:  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 61.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: Young willow shoots. Touching, brushing, the water. Of the garden pool. Sao Feng dismisses the Maidens. He offers her wine.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: I admit, this is not how I expected to be treated.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: No other treatment would be worthy of you ... Calypso. Elizabeth freezes with the glass at her lips.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: Not the name you fancy, I imagine, out of the many that you have ... but it is what we call you.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: We being who?

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: Whom.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Who. Sao Feng considers it, shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: We of the Brethren Court and our predecessors, who concealed you in this form. Your forgiveness. I lied. Who imprisoned you -- oh. "Who." You were right.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Goddess.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: You confirm it?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Confirm what? You've told me nothing.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: The Brethren Court -- not I, the first Brethren Court, who ... whom (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: . whose decision I would have opposed ... they bound you in human form, so that rule of the seas would belong to men, and not

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Me.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: But one such as you should never be anything less than what you are.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Pretty speech from a captor. But words whispered through prison bars lose their charm.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: Can I be blamed for my efforts? All men are drawn to the sea. Perilous though it may be.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Some men offer desire as justification for their crimes.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: I offer simply my desire.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: An item of such small value. And in return?

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: I would have your gifts, should you choose to give them.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: And if I choose not?

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: Then I will take your fury. He leans in -- kisses her. She pushes him back In the distance, there is a muffled distant explosion -- incoming projectile -- a sudden CRASH. Outside, there are shouts and screams, cannon fire and pistol shots. Elizabe ducks down as lead balls slam into the hull -- Elizabeth glances through the porthole -- smoke and flash of explosion, she only make out the ship is under attack A second cannon ball hits blasts through the hull.  594 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 63. Sao Feng lies on the deck, bloody, a long sharp shard of wood buried in his chest.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Sao Feng?

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: Here. Please. Sao Feng removes the rope knot pendant he wears.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Captain's Knot. Take it. (she hesitates) So you'll be free! Take it! I must pass it on to the next Brethren Lord.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: Go in my place to Shipwreck Cove. She takes the pendant. Tai Huang bursts through the door Sounds of fighting follow him into the cabin --

dialogues.speaker: TAI HUANG
dialogues.text: Captain! The ship is taken! We cannot -- He pulls up short, takes in the scene. Sao Feng, mortally wounded, bleeding, whispers something low to Elizabeth, w listens intently.

dialogues.speaker: SAO FENG
dialogues.text: Calypso ... He dies in Elizabeth's arms.

dialogues.speaker: TAI HUANG
dialogues.text: What did he tell you? She holds up the pendant, now hanging around her neck

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: He made me Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth steps onto the deck -- littered with bodies, ca smoke hanging in the air. Sails ripped to shreds. Moans f injured sailors. Huang follows behind her. -- the Flying Dutchman, with its contingent of encrusted crewmen. Elizabeth watches as they continue to swarm onto the ship, round up terrified sailors. Smoke on deck parts  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 64. And there is Commodore Norrington, striding forward, surv the damage. He lifts his eyes -- and sees Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: James?

dialogues.speaker: NORRINGTON
dialogues.text: Elizabeth! He embraces her. She endures it.

dialogues.speaker: NORRINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I heard you were dead!

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: And I mourned you. He self-consciously straightens his uniform jacket.

dialogues.speaker: NORRINGTON
dialogues.text: Your father will be overjoyed to know you are well.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: My father is dead.

dialogues.speaker: NORRINGTON
dialogues.text: No, he's not. He returned to England.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Lord Beckett told you that?

dialogues.speaker: PALES
dialogues.text: Davy Jones steps past them, questions a line up of sailor

dialogues.speaker: DAVY JONES
dialogues.text: Who among you do you name as Captain? Huang points quickly at Elizabeth --

dialogues.speaker: HUANG
dialogues.text: Captain! Her! Other sailors quickly chime in, point. Norrington looks a Elizabeth, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: NORRINGTON
dialogues.text: Tow the ship. Take the sailors to the brig.

dialogues.speaker: DAVY JONES
dialogues.text: You heard the Admiral!  595 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 65.

dialogues.speaker: NORRINGTON
dialogues.text: The Captain may have my quarters.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: No thank you, sir. I prefer to remain with my crew. She moves to follow her crew, being led away.

dialogues.speaker: NORRINGTON
dialogues.text: Elizabeth, I swear -- I did not know.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Know what? Which side you chose? Now you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crew members of the Empress are locked in various cells. JIMMY LEGS closes the bar on Elizabeth, alone. A thought hits her -- she asks tentatively:

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Bootstrap? Jimmy Legs just laughs, and moves away. He passes Clacker who mops the deck. Elizabeth calls to him, softly:

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bootstrap? Bill Turner? Clacker grunts and turns his back. Elizabeth gives up, sl down in the cell. Next to her, EYES in the ship's hull OP

dialogues.speaker: BOOTSTRAP
dialogues.text: You know my name. Elizabeth jumps. Looks. She is not alone. BOOTSTRAP BILL there. A barely human form, seemingly part of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: I know your son. Will Turner.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTSTRAP
dialogues.text: William! He's all right? (she nods) He made it! He's alive. Hah! And now he's sent you to tell me that he's coming to get me. He promised. God's wounds, he's on his way!

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Yes. Will is alive, and -- he wants to help you.  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 66. There is hope in his eyes -- then a thought suddenly hits Hope vanishes. Despair clouds his features.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTSTRAP
dialogues.text: No. He can't come. He won't come.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: I don't know how, but he will try, I am sure. You're ... his father Bootstraps looks slyly at her

dialogues.speaker: BOOTSTRAP
dialogues.text: I know you. He spoke of you. Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTSTRAP
dialogues.text: He can't save me. He won't. Because of you.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: BOOTSTRAP
dialogues.text: You're Elizabeth. Bootstrap falls silent. Elizabeth waits, then prompts him

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Yes. I'm Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTSTRAP
dialogues.text: If Jones be slain ... he who slays him takes his place. Captain. Forever Every man before the mast knows that, Elizabeth! The Dutchman must have a Captain. Elizabeth puts it together.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: I see --

dialogues.speaker: BOOTSTRAP
dialogues.text: If he saves me ... he loses you.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTSTRAP
dialogues.text: He won't pick me. I wouldn't pick me. The Dutchman must have a Captain.  596 597 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 67.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: You said that. Bootstrap nods, slowly fades back into the ship.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTSTRAP
dialogues.text: Tell him -- don't come! Tell him -- stay away! Can you tell him? It's too late. I'm part of the ship. The crew. Bootstrap's eyes close, he becomes utterly still. Elizabe reaches out a hand to comfort him. Suddenly his eyes open

dialogues.speaker: BOOTSTRAP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know my name. (Elizabeth frowns) You know my name!

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Yes. I know your son.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTSTRAP
dialogues.text: William! He's alive? Bootstrap stares, waiting for the answer. Elizabeth nods.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTSTRAP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He'll come for me. He promised. You'll see. Bootstrap fades back into the hull. Elizabeth regards him with horror ... and pity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Greitzer scans the horizon with a spyglass. Be looks the opposite direction, out to sea. ON THE HORIZON, a blur of movement. The faint, raucous CR of birds can be heard. Beckett is thoughtful.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: Glass. THROUGH THE SPYGLASS, a spinning TOWER of SEAGULLS rises over some floating object --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gulls circle, filling the sky. Their cries much LOUDER. IN THE WATER, a dead BODY. Bloated and pale. It is one of Beckett's men, killed in the Black Pearl's escape, lashed two barrels. A SEAGULL pecks at the man's ear, flies away with the prize, pursued by others --  598 599 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The body is hauled onto the deck. Beckett removes a rum b with a note inside. He fishes the paper out, unrolls it - on it is the SYMBOL of the East India Trading Company. Greitzer spots something.

dialogues.speaker: GREITZER
dialogues.text: Sir. Beckett looks up. On the edge of the horizon, faint and n out of sight -- another whirling TOWER OF SEAGULLS.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: Like bread crumbs. Ghastly. (re: the note) And we are meant to follow.

dialogues.speaker: GREITZER
dialogues.text: A betrayer among them? Or a trap?

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: A gambit. By a skilled opponent. (smiles) Adjust course, Lieutenant. Greitzer is surprised, but nods.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We can only hope to reach our destination ... before they run out of bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will ties a body to a barrel. He's working almost automatically. He uses his knife to cut a rope -- pauses. Gazes at it. The anguish is apparent.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You escaped the brig even quicker than I expected. Will whirls, ready for attackers -- Jack lounges on the rail above the forecastle. How long h he been there?

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hold on, William. Do you notice anything? Or, rather, do you not notice anything? Or, rather, do you notice something that is not there to be noticed?  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 69.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: You haven't raised an alarm.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: That's odd, isn't it? He drops down to the forecastle, looks over Will's handiw

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But not so odd as this. You came up with this all on your lonesome?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: I said to myself, think like Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: And this is what you arrived at? Lead Beckett to Shipwreck Cove so as to win his trust and accomplish your own ends? It's like you don't know me at all.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Think like Jack, but do what's right.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: And how does your dearly beloved feel about your plan? Will returns to his work without answering.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ah. You've not seen fit to trust her with it.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: I'm losing her, Jack. Every step I make for my father ... is a step away from Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: If you choose to lock your heart away, you will lose her for certain. But if I might offer an exceedingly simple solution: Don't save your father.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: I have to. I can't turn my back on him.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: "Can't" is a matter of fact. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can if you want, but you won't -- and that makes it a choice. Will considers his words, unable to disagree.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's what life is, boyo: choices. Out of all the things you can do, what will you do? Will is now at a loss ... slumps. Just where Jack wanted him:

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If I might lend a machete to your intellectual thicket: Avoid the choice altogether. Change the facts. Let someone else dispatch Jones.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Who? (Jack indicates: "me") You?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Death has a way of reshuffling one's priorities. I slip aboard the Dutchman, I find the heart and stab the beating thing. Your father goes free from his debt, and you are free to be with your charming murderess.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: And you bind yourself to the Dutchman -- forever.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No, I am free forever. Free to sail the seas, beyond the edges of he map, free from death itself. Crew aboard the Dutchman is one thing but Captain? Sign me up.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: You have to do the job. You have to ferry souls to the next world or end up just like Jones. Jack considers what that might be like, puppeteering his beard braids like tentacles. Shudders.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I don't have the face for tentacles. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 600 601 602 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 71.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then I'll take on the obligation and not quite be completely free ... but immortal has to count for something. Now, here. He hands Will his compass.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: What's this for?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Think like me. It'll come to you. Will puzzles -- then realizes exactly what Jack is going do just a half-a-second too late -- and Jack SHOVES HIM O THE SIDE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will hits the water. He surfaces. The BARREL (with body) SPLASHES down beside him, narrowly missing him. Will haul himself atop.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (leans out) Give my regards to Davy Jones! He smile broadly, waves, disappears.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: I hate him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amid calm seas, the Empress is towed by the Dutchman. Oth ships in the group are dark outlines against the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth's eyes open at the sound of her jail door openi Norrington is there.

dialogues.speaker: NORRINGTON
dialogues.text: Be quiet. This way. Hurry. Sao Feng's crew members look to Elizabeth. She nods, and they move past.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: NORRINGTON
dialogues.text: Choosing a side.  603 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 72. She follows him. The cell door hangs open. Bootstrap Bill appears, staring at the open. He pushes it open further . shuffles through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norrington leads Elizabeth and her crew to the tow rope. Like rats on a line, crew members crawl across to the Emp

dialogues.speaker: NORRINGTON
dialogues.text: One at a time. Quickly now. (to Elizabeth) Do not go to Shipwreck Cove. Beckett knows of the meeting of the Brethren. I fear there is a traitor among them.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: It is too late to earn my forgiveness.

dialogues.speaker: NORRINGTON
dialogues.text: I do not ask it. I had nothing to do with your father's death. But that does not absolve me of my other sins. Elizabeth looks at him -- and finally believes him.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Come with us. Norrington wants to come.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: James. Come with me. Norrington really wants to. Nearly all of the Chinese cre members are across. Elizabeth implores him. Then there is sound from the deck -- a FIGURE shuffles toward them.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTSTRAP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Who goes there? The moment is broken. A lingering look -- and then Norrin draws his sword, turns. Elizabeth stands beside him.

dialogues.speaker: NORRINGTON
dialogues.text: GO! I will follow.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: You're lying.

dialogues.speaker: NORRINGTON
dialogues.text: Our destinies have been entwined Elizabeth. But never joined. Norrington gives in -- and kisses her. He breaks the kiss  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 73.

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: He shoves her away. Turns. The Figure grabs a pike for a weapon. Steps out of the dark. It is Bootstrap Bill.

dialogues.speaker: NORRINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Back to your station, sailor. Elizabeth, upside down, crawls along the line. Bootstrap sees her. Something isn't right. Not quite sure what.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTSTRAP
dialogues.text: No one leaves the ship.

dialogues.speaker: NORRINGTON
dialogues.text: Stand down. That's an order

dialogues.speaker: BOOTSTRAP
dialogues.text: Part of the crew. Part of the ship. Bootstrap stares, like he's trying to figure it all out.

dialogues.speaker: NORRINGTON
dialogues.text: Steady, man. Something snaps in Bootstrap.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTSTRAP
dialogues.text: All hands! All hands! Prisoner escape, all hands! Norrington races toward Bootstrap.

dialogues.speaker: NORRINGTON
dialogues.text: Belay that! Bootstrap shuts up. Too late. The SOUND of running FOOTST approach. Crewmen appear -- Elizabeth, hanging upside down, is halfway across. She se he is in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: James! She starts back toward him -- Norrington draws his pistol, aims upwards, FIRES -- -- hitting the tow line, severing half the strands. The o strands quickly strain and SNAP -- Elizabeth swings down and away, SPLASHES into the water, the EMPRESS drifts free. She hangs on, pulls hand over ha  604 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 74. Norrington spins back -- AND IS RUN THROUGH, stabbed by Bootstrap Bill. Norrington cries out in pain -- NEAR THE EMPRESS, Elizabeth grabs a rope, dangles near th hull. As the two ships part, as she disappears into darkn she looks back in time to see --

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: -- Norrington collapse to the deck. Bootstrap stands over him ... doesn't understand what he has done. Crewmen appe crowd the deck, staring.

dialogues.speaker: CLACKER
dialogues.text: The Admiral's dead. The Admiral's dead! The phrase echoes through the Crewmen. Davy Jones appears

dialogues.speaker: CLACKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: To the Captain's Cabin! Aye! Crewmen race away, past Jones, past Bootstrap, knocking h back. Bootstrap still doesn't understand. Jones leans dow

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: James Norrington ... do you fear death? Do you fear judgment on the other side? Norrington suddenly lurches upwards, thrusting his sword into Jones' shoulder. Jones frowns, unaffected, unhurt. Norrington stares... then collapses, dead.

dialogues.speaker: JONES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I take that as a -- 'no.' Jones pulls Norrington's sword out of his shoulder. Regar the blade with genuine appreciation

dialogues.speaker: JONES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nice sword. He slashes it through the air --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crewmen rush pell-mell along the deck amid shouts of 'The Admiral's dead!' 'to the Captain's Cabin!' They rush the door and burst in --  605 606 607 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pirates crowd in and before them is a tableau: The chest open. Murtogg and Mullroy, trembling, and several other SOLDIERS have their rifles pointed directly at the heart. And behind them stands -- Mercer. Next to him is a small cannon. The Pirates pull up short. They part as Davy Jone enters. Jones is scared.

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: Close it. CLOSE IT. Jones nods. Mercer closes the chest, locks it with a KEY a chain. He tilts the cannon into place -- pointed square at the chest.

dialogues.speaker: MERCER
dialogues.text: Nothing has changed. Jones watches as Mercer puts the chain around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Gibbs on the aft deck. Cotton at the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Look alive and keep a careful eye! Not for nothing it's called Shipwreck Island, where lies Shipwreck Cove and Shipwreck City!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You know, for all that pirates are clever clogs capable of the most underhanded and duplicitous thinking ... We are an unimaginative lot when it comes to naming things.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Aye. ON THE FORWARD DECK, Tia Dalma finds Barbossa. 607

dialogues.speaker: TIA DALMA
dialogues.text: Barbossa, why you not giving the order to man the guns? All the Brethren be gathered in this place. You can force them do as you want!

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: What I want is not to act the fool, and what you're suggesting is nought but fool's folly. Tia Dalma caresses Barbossa's cheek seductively.  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 76.

dialogues.speaker: TIA DALMA
dialogues.text: If you no longer want my favor, Barbossa, then perhaps I should be calling a different captain to my cause. Witty Jack would not turn down the promise to survive the coming storm, I think.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: I do not renege on a bargain once struck, but we agreed to ends only; the means are mine to decide. Tia Dalma catches his wrist. She squeezes, and his forear and hand become decayed, skeletal -- dead.

dialogues.speaker: TIA DALMA
dialogues.text: Caution, Barbossa. Do not forget it was by my power you be returned from the dead ... or what it means if you fail me. She moves away, but he catches her arm and pulls her clos

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: And don't you forget why you had to bring me back, and why I could not leave Jack to his well-deserved fate, and why I could not give Sao Feng a second smile in his throat to match that ineffably smug one he wears on his face. It took nine Pirate Lords to bind you, Calypso -- and it takes no less than nine to set you free. 'Til then, I'll not be taking commands from you, nor risk you reaching accord with someone else! Mr. Pintel! Mr. Ragetti! Take this ... fishwife to the brig! Pintel and Ragetti hurry to comply.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Right this way, Missus Fish. 608 ON THE AFT DECK, the exchange has not escaped Jack. 6

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Step out, Mr. Cotton. (he takes the wheel) There's some dangerous cross tides ahead that will prove a trick to navigate.  609 610 611 612 613 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Black Pearl sails straight at the cliff, as if it wil run aground. But revealed amid the rocks is a huge SEA TU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Black Pearl sails through. Gibbs glances over the sid

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Deep enough for the ship's draw. I would never have believed it.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: If you knew how many died making it deep enough -- you'd believe. They sail toward a distant light. The ship passes outside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM ABOVE, Shipwreck Island is hollow, with a round wate cove. In the center is Shipwreck City, constructed of bro derelict ships. Moored around the city -- PIRATE SHIPS, of all types, fro all over the world. PULL BACK to find Pintel, Ragetti and Jack as they stare out.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Look at them all!

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: There's not been a gathering like this in our lifetime.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: And I owe all of them money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squawking seagulls circle above the Endeavour,diving down the barrels on deck. The Flying Dutchman is moored alongs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door is opened by Groves, who steps out of the way (quickly) to let an angry Jones pass.

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: I cannot be summoned like some mongrel pup.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: Apparently, you can. I believe you know each other. 609 610 611 612 613  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 78. He gestures to: Will, who holds a teacup and saucer. He n to Jones.

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: Come to join my crew again, Master Turner?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Not yours. His. (suddenly 'remembers' ) Jack Sparrow sends his regards. Beckett is surprised by that -- just as Will intended.

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: Sparrow?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: (to Beckett) You didn't tell him Jack was rescued from the locker? Along with the Black Pearl? ("tsk, tsk") Jones absorbs this, turns his ire on Beckett.

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: What else have you kept from me?

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: There is another issue (pointed toward will) far more troubling. (to Jones) You are familiar with a person called "Calypso"? Jones tries for a measured response, but is not quite successful.

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: Not a person. A heathen god. who delights in cursing men with their wildest dreams, and then revealing them to be hollow and nought but ash. The world is well-rid of her.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Not quite so well, actually. (sips his tea) The Brethren Court intends to release her.

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: No. They cannot! (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: JONES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The first court promised to keep her imprisoned forever! That was our agreement!

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: Your agreement?

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: I told them how to bind her. She could not be trusted. She gave me no choice. Will clocks that; the words are familiar --

dialogues.speaker: JONES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Beckett) We must act before they release her -- and Will realizes:

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: You loved her. Jones snaps a look at him.

dialogues.speaker: WILL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She's the one. And then you betrayed her.

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: he pretended to love me. She betrayed

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: And after which betrayal did you cut out your heart, I wonder? Jones hurls the table out of the way, slaps away Will's t cup, gets right in his face.

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: Do not test me!

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: (re: his tea) I wasn't finished with that. (down to business) You will free my father. (stands; to Beckett) And you will guarantee Elizabeth's safety, and my own. Will considers that briefly, shrugs: sure, makes sense.  614 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 80.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: Your terms are steep, Mr. Turner. We will expect fair value in return.

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: There is only one price I will accept: Calypso. Murdered.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Calypso is aboard the Black Pearl. Jack has sailed the Black Pearl to Shipwreck Cove.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: -- with you no longer aboard it. How do you proposed to lead us there? Will holds up Jack's Compass.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: What is it you want most?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON JACK as he stabs his sword into a GLOBE, joining seven other swords. He flinches at the BOOM! BOOM! of Barbossa hammering the table top with a cannon ball.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: As he who issued summons, I convene this, the fourth Brethren Court. Your pieces of eight, my fellow captains. An ABANDONED HULL, curved spars of a wrecked ship, like t ribs of some prehistoric beast. Pirate Lords sit at the t their lieutenants behind them. With Jack and Barbossa are: AMMAND the CORSAIR, the scour of the Barbary Coast; VILLANUEVA, a taciturn Spaniard, CAPITAINE CHEVALLE, an aristocratic Frenchman; GENTLEMAN JOCARD, slave turned pirate; MISTRESS CHING, a blind Chin woman; and a serene and priestly-looking Hindu, SRI SUMBH flanked by the two biggest, nastiest-looking guys you've ever seen: AKSHAY and PUSAN. The Lords toss their pieces of eight into a wooden bowl w contains a Queen of Spades: A snuff box. The neck of a bo with cork still in. A pair of spectacles. Etc.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Those aren't pieces of eight. Those are just pieces of junk.  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 81.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Aye, the original plan called for nine pieces of eight to bind Calypso, but when the first Court met, the Brethren were to a one skint-broke.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: So change the name.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: What, to nine pieces of whatever we happened to have in our pockets at the time? Oh, yes, that sounds real pirate-y.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: (holds out his hand) Mr. Ragetti, if you will?

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: I kept it safe, like you said when you gave it to me.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Aye, you have, but now I need it back. Ragetti hesitates. Barbossa holds his hand under Ragetti' eye, gives him a slap on the back of his head -- the eye falls into his hand. Barbossa drops the eye into the bowl

dialogues.speaker: MISTRESS CHING
dialogues.text: We're missing two. By the sound of it.

dialogues.speaker: VILLANUEVA
dialogues.text: Sparrow. Jack reaches for the coin circlet on his headband, consid Barbossa takes note of the gesture -- Jack drops his hand

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: We're still short one Pirate Lord. I'm content to wait until Sao Feng joins us.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sao Feng is dead. Elizabeth stands in the doorway, with Huang behind her. S starts in; Huang touches her shoulder, gestures to the gl

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Before he died, he named me captain of the Empress, and passed his lordship onto me.  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 82. She stabs her sword into the globe.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Captain? Captain? They're just giving the title away now. Sumbhajee makes a small gesture to Ashay.

dialogues.speaker: AKSHAY
dialogues.text: Sri Sambhajee inquires, by whose hand did Sao Feng perish?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Hers, I'll wager.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Will you never forgive me? (answering the question) He fell to the Flying Dutchman. An uproar of concern, OVERLAPPING dialogue --

dialogues.speaker: CHEVALLE CHING
dialogues.text: Le monster des The plague ship -- profondeures!

dialogues.speaker: VALLENUEVA
dialogues.text: iEchelo en infierno! -- ending with this line, which must be clearly heard:

dialogues.speaker: AMMAND
dialogues.text: with the Dutchman against us, there is no hope!

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Listen! Listen to me! Our location has been betrayed. Jones, under the command of Lord Beckett -- they are on their way here.

dialogues.speaker: JOCARD
dialogues.text: Who is this betrayer?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Not likely anyone among us. Elizabeth realizes --

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: (to Jack) Where's Will?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Not among us.  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 83.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: And it matters not how they found us! The question is, what will we do now that they have?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: We fight. The other pirates laugh, dismissive.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good men have already given their lives to this cause!

dialogues.speaker: AKSHAY
dialogues.text: (playing to the other pirates) And so what matters the lives of a few bad ones, quips Sri Sumbhajee. More laughter.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: They died in defiance of the Company. That's my measure of good. That silences them. Jack regards Elizabeth, calculating.

dialogues.speaker: MISTRESS CHING
dialogues.text: Shipwreck Cove is a fortress, a well- supplied fortress. There is no need to fight, if they cannot get to us. Others of the Court give that consideration.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: There be a third course. (gathers them by eye) In another age -- at this very spot! -- the first Brethren Court captured the Sea Goddess, and bound her in her bones. That was a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We tamed the seas for ourselves, aye, yet opened the door for Beckett and his ilk. Better were the days when mastery of seas came not through bargains struck with eldritch creatures, but by the sweat of a man's brow and the strength of his back alone. And you all know this be true! They do.  The pirate lords are silent WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 84.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gentlemen ... free Calypso.

dialogues.speaker: AKSHAY
dialogues.text: He has lost his senses, declares Sri Sumbhajee!

dialogues.speaker: AMMAND
dialogues.text: She is a barathrum! ladies ... we must . and then erupt --

dialogues.speaker: CHEVALLE
dialogues.text: Démence!

dialogues.speaker: CHING
dialogues.text: (in chinese) No good can come of this!

dialogues.speaker: VILLANUEVA JOCARD
dialogues.text: Ella es nuestra diosa! Don't let him speak any further!

dialogues.speaker: AMMAND
dialogues.text: Shoot him!

dialogues.speaker: JOCARD
dialogues.text: Cut out his tongue!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Shoot him and then cut out his tongue! And then shoot his tongue. And trim that scraggly beard.

dialogues.speaker: HUANG
dialogues.text: Sao Feng would have agreed with Barbossa.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Sao Feng's judgment in matters Calypso shouldn't be trusted, even if he were here. The last is directed primarily to Huang. Huang takes her point, steps back.

dialogues.speaker: VILLANUEVA
dialogues.text: Nonetheless, I would have agreed with Sao Feng.

dialogues.speaker: JOCARD
dialogues.text: Calypso was our enemy then, she will be our enemy now.

dialogues.speaker: CHEVALLE
dialogues.text: And her mood's not likely improved, n'est pas? Villanueva pulls out his pistol, SLAMS it on the table.  6150 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 85.

dialogues.speaker: VILLANUEVA
dialogues.text: I would still agree with Sao Feng.

dialogues.speaker: CHEVALLE
dialogues.text: You threaten me?

dialogues.speaker: VILLANUEVA
dialogues.text: I silence you! He lifts the pistol -- but Chevalle punches him, sends hi sprawling into other pirates, the pistol FIRES --

dialogues.speaker: CHING AMMAND
dialogues.text: vézu! No! A pox upon thee!

dialogues.speaker: JOCARD AKSHAY
dialogues.text: Coward! Feathermerchant ! Sri Sumbhajee decries you all! -- Which initiates a pushing, shoving, yelling melee that breaks out in a full-blown brawl --

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: This is madness.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: This is politics.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: And, meanwhile, our enemy is bearing down upon us.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: If they not be here already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON TIA DALMA'S LOCKET, open, playing its tune. She shuts . but the TUNE continues. She looks to the shadows beyond the bars ... JONES emerges, his own locket in his hand, open.

dialogues.speaker: TIA DALMA
dialogues.text: My sweet captain ... you've come for me at last.

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: You were expecting me?

dialogues.speaker: TIA DALMA
dialogues.text: Long ago. It has been torture, trapped in but this single form, condemned to exist on land, cut off from the sea, from all that I love ... from you.  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 86.

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: No. Ten years I devoted to the duty you charged to me, ten years I looked after those who died at sea ... and, finally, when the time came I could be with you again ... you weren't there. Why weren't you there?

dialogues.speaker: TIA DALMA
dialogues.text: It is my nature. I may have been there the next time. Would you love me if I was anything but what I am?

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: I do not love you. His words sting her.

dialogues.speaker: TIA DALMA
dialogues.text: Many things you were, Davy Jones ... but never cruel. You have corrupted your purpose, and so yourself She reaches a hand out through the bars, toward his chest

dialogues.speaker: TIA DALMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ... and you hid away what should always have been mine. She touches his chest, where his heart should be -- and h is REVEALED now, the MAN he once was. He reaches back through the bars, to caress her face ...

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: . Calypso ...

dialogues.speaker: TIA DALMA
dialogues.text: I will be free. And when I am, I would give you my heart ... and we would be together, always . He traces his hand down the contours of her face ...

dialogues.speaker: TIA DALMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: . if only you had a heart to give. She removes his hand from her chest; and now the hand tha was at her throat is his CLAW.

dialogues.speaker: TIA DALMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why did you come? Jones removes his claw from her neck, pulls it back -- it "tings" against the bars of the cell, trapped inside.  6160 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 87. Jones concentrates, shudders -- and pushes himself THROUG THE BARS, into the cell with Tia Dalma

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: And what fate do you have planned for your captors?

dialogues.speaker: TIA DALMA
dialogues.text: The Brethren Court, all of them, the last thing they will learn in this life ... is how cruel I can be. Jones nods. He steps away from her, toward the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: TIA DALMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And what of your fate, Davy Jones? He pauses. Turns his head toward her without turning from the shadows:

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: My heart will always belong to you. She smiles, opens her locket -- the TUNE resumes. Jones vanishes into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The brawl still in full force. Elizabeth sits in her chai head resting on her fist, exasperated. Barbossa BANGS the cannonballs, trying to regain order, steps up on the tabl

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: It was the first Court what imprisoned Calypso! We shall be the ones to set her free! And, in her gratitude, she will see fit to grant us boons!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Or at least grant ‘em to the one of us who summoned the rest of us and connived all of us to set her free. Barbossa shoots him a glare. The other pirates eye Barbos suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's not impossible. Is it so improbable?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: If you have a better alternative please, share.  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 88.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Cuttlefish. Nasty little buggers. Pen 'em up together, and they'll devour each other without a second thought. So, yes, we could hole up here, well-provisioned and well-armed, and half of us will be dead within the month, and half of the other half dead the month after that. The pirate lords can't argue with that. Aye!

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Or, we can release Calypso, and we can pray she'll be in a merciful mood. But can we pretend that she is anything other than a woman scorned, like which fury hell hath no? No, we cannot. Res ipso loquitur tabula in naufragi, we are left with only one option. I agree with -- (gets it out) Captain Swann: we must fight.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: You've always run away from a fight!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Slander and calumny! I have only ever embraced that oldest, noblest of all pirate traditions. My fellow mariners and shellbacks, I submit that here, now, that is what we all must do. We must fight to run away!

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS JOCARD
dialogues.text: Here, here!

dialogues.speaker: MISTRESS CHING
dialogues.text: And what be target of this fight eh?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Lord Cutler Beckett.

dialogues.speaker: CHEVALLE
dialogues.text: Beckett is nought but a cog. Kill him, another takes his place. Like Jones, the East India Trading Company is immortal. It has no body to kick nor soul to damn.  617 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 89.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Ah, but Jones does have a body, doesn't he? Such as it is.

dialogues.speaker: JOCARD
dialogues.text: Yes! And should we kick it hard enough and long enough ...

dialogues.speaker: AMMAND
dialogues.text: If the Dutchman has no captain what matters the Dutchman? Barbossa sees the sentiment of the room beginning to sway he bangs the cannon ball for attention.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: As per the Code ... an act of war and this be exactly that, can only be declared by the Pirate King.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You made that up.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Did I now? I call on Captain Teague, Keeper of the Code! Barbossa grins at Jack's "oh, crap, not him" expression. Sumbhajee makes another small gesture; Ashay interprets:

dialogues.speaker: AKSHAY
dialogues.text: Sri Sumbhajee proclaims this be folly. We are not beholden to those ancient, outdated set of laws! Hang the Code! Are we not free to -- A PISTOL SHOT rings out -- and Akshay stiffens, falls ove Everyone looks over -- except Jack Behind him stands CAPTAIN TEAGUE in a doorway, gunslinger pose, smoke still rising from his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: TEAGUE
dialogues.text: The Code is the law. Hand on the butt of a second pistol, he stares at Sumbhaj Sumbhajee gestures to Pusan to step into Ashay's place. P looks nervous as Sambhajee gestures again -- and then gre relieved.

dialogues.speaker: PUSAN
dialogues.text: Sri Sambhajee explains that a great misunderstanding has occurred, and (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: PUSAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: avers that indeed the Code is the Law. Jack stands between Teague and the table.

dialogues.speaker: TEAGUE
dialogues.text: You're in my way, boy. Jack turns to look at him ... then steps aside as two pir carry a Locked Manuscript into the room -- THE CODE.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: (with awe, to Ragetti) The Code!

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: (with awe, to Pintel) As set forth by Morgan and Bartholomew! Teague whistles -- and the PRISON DOG runs into the room, key ring in his mouth. Pintel and Ragetti recognize him -

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: That can't be the same pooch, can it?

dialogues.speaker: TEAGUE
dialogues.text: (to Pintel & Ragetti) Sea turtles, mate. Teague takes the key, unlocks, opens the book. Pages thro licking his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: TEAGUE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (under his breath) . compensation ... left leg, above knee ... shooting customs agents ... rum drinks ... ah. Reaches a page. Reads it. Looks up.

dialogues.speaker: TEAGUE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Barbossa is right. He goes to shut the book. Jack stops him, reads the passa himself. Teague considers shooting him.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: "It be the duties of the King to declare war, parley with shared adversaries, co-ordinate forces ... Fancy that.  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 91. Teague retires to a chair at the back of the court, begin strumming a mandolin.

dialogues.speaker: CHEVALLE
dialogues.text: There's not been a King since the first court, and that's not likely to change.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: See, the king is elected by popular vote --

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: (smug) -- and each pirate only ever votes for hisself. Jack knows he's going to put in a pin in Barbossa's ballo

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I call for a vote! Barbossa is dismayed.

dialogues.speaker: AMMAND
dialogues.text: (raises hand) I vote for Ammand the Corsair

dialogues.speaker: CHEVALLE
dialogues.text: Capitaine Chevalle, the penniless Frenchman.

dialogues.speaker: PUSAN
dialogues.text: Sri Sumbhajee declares for Sri Sumbhajee.

dialogues.speaker: MISTRESS CHING
dialogues.text: Mistress Ching.

dialogues.speaker: JOCARD
dialogues.text: Gentleman Jocard.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Elizabeth Swann.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Barbossa.

dialogues.speaker: VALLENUEVA
dialogues.text: Vallenueva.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Elizabeth Swann.  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 92. Barboosa knows he's been foxed. Elizabeth is shocked, but quick on the uptake.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Done. Cries of outrage from the Pirates.

dialogues.speaker: JOCARD MISTRESS CHING
dialogues.text: Not done! Outrageous! (bu xiang hua)

dialogues.speaker: VILLANUEVA PUSAN
dialogues.text: Not acceptable! Not If Sri Sumbhajee is not acceptable! king, none should be!

dialogues.speaker: AMMAND CHEVALLE
dialogues.text: Explain yourself, This will not stand! Sparrow!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Ah. Am I to understand, then, that we will not keep to code? SPLANG! One of Teague's mandolin strings breaks. Jack kno Teague's got his back on this. The lords exchange glances

dialogues.speaker: MISTRESS CHING
dialogues.text: Very well. What say you, Captain Swann, King of the Brethren Court? Elizabeth gaze takes in all the Pirate Lords. She stands makes her pronouncement.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Prepare every vessel that can float. At dawn, we are at war. A beat, as the pirates contemplate this.

dialogues.speaker: SUMBHAJEE
dialogues.text: (high-pitched voice) And so we shall go to war!

dialogues.speaker: JOCARD
dialogues.text: War! The pirates rise up and vow WAR! Slap each other on the b Start to exit the meeting. Barbossa glowers at Jack. Jack smiles victoriously back Bargossa nods to Pintel and Ragetti. Ragetti slips the bo behind his back, Pintel walks close behind to cover the t Jack, his back turned to the proceedings, closes his eyes The betrayal of all time is in place.  618 619 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 93.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: There's more beneath the waterline here then you're letting on. Jack opens his eyes, wide, innocent.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You used to have a honest streak, let a man knew where he stood with you. But I can't figure this at all.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: And where did that honest streak end me up? Dead.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Jack --

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Mr. Gibbs. You've a ship to ready for battle, don't you? Gibbs is taken aback. Fine, if that's how he wants it:

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Aye-aye, Captain. He goes. Jack notices Teague, watching him.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What? You've seen it all. And survived. That's the trick, isn't it? To survive.

dialogues.speaker: TEAGUE
dialogues.text: It's not just about living forever, Jackie. The trick is, living with yourself forever. He takes a shrunken head from his belt, offers it to Jack Odd. Jack takes it. Teague nods to him, and leaves him to his thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shipwreck island in the background ... PAN TO REVEAL the Black Pearl as it joins the Empress, and the collected pi ships, ready for battle. Pirates sharpen swords, clamber over the ship, make ready for sea. ON DECK, Marty peers ahead, into fog-shrouded waters -- Out of the fog, a SINGLE SHIP appears, the ENDEAVOUR. 618 619  620 621 622 623 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty raises the alarm --

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: The enemy is here! Let's take 'em! Blood-curdling SCREAMS as PIRATES YELL their approval -- AYE! Strong, loud, confident -- MORE SHIPS appear ... more ships ... even more ships. Wit ship revealed, the YELLS of the pirates grow less certain FOG CLEARS -- revealing the HUGE ARMADA of the East India Trading Company. Every manner of ship, HUNDREDS OF THEM, poised and ready for battle -- IN THE SEA AHEAD, the Flying Dutchman rises up through th to lead the East India Trading Company Fleet. ON THE ENDEAVOUR, Beckett lowers his spyglass. Groves sta next to him.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: Well played again, Jack. And what's your next move? ON THE BLACK PEARL: silence. Cotton's Parrot swoops down wheels past, FLAP-FLAP-FLAPping its wings, getting the he out of there, headed back toward the island .. All eyes turn to Jack -- eyes belonging to angry pirates all armed -- what the hell do we do now, Sparrow?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Parlay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sparkling white strip of sand. Jack, Elizabeth and Barb walking away from a longboat beached on one side, toward second longboat on the other side. The threesome draw near to three others: Beckett, Davy Jo and Will. They regard each other in silence.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: (to Will) You be the cur that led these wolves to our door.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: Don't blame Turner. He was but the tool of your betrayal.  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 95.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you wish to see its grand architect -- look to your left. Elizabeth, Barbossa, Jack the Monkey -- look over at Jack Jack looks to his left, too.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Me? My hands are clean in this. Figuratively.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: My actions were my own, to my own purpose. Jack had nothing to do with it.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: There! Listen to the tool.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Will, I've been aboard the Dutchman I understand the burden you bear But I fear that cause is lost.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: No cause is lost if there is but one fool left to fight for it. Will's eyes shift toward Jack. Elizabeth clocks it -- gla at Jack. Calculates.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: If Turner was not acting on your behalf, then how did he come to give me this? Beckett holds up Jack's Compass. That convinces Barbossa.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You made a deal with me, Jack, to deliver the pirates -- and here they are. Don't be bashful; step up and claim your reward. He tosses the Compass; Jack catches it.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: And what reward does such chicanery fetch these days?

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: Her. (Will is shocked) When the cannon smoke clears and the brethren slaughtered, off he sails on the Pearl, Elizabeth in his arms  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 96.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: and the blame dead square upon his rival. There is a moment of silence as this settles in.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Even if that was my plan -- and I'm not admitting to anything -- there's not a tinker's chance of it coming off anymore. (to Elizabeth) Is there?

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: There never was.

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: Your debt to me must still be satisfied. One hundred years in servitude aboard the Dutchman ... as a start. Elizabeth reacts to the mention of the Dutchman -- she realizes what Jack is after. A glance at Will. Will gives the slightest indication: yes.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: That debt was paid. (to Elizabeth) With some help.

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: You escaped.

dialogues.speaker: JACK/ JONES
dialogues.text: A technicality.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: There's no better end for Jack Sparrow than bilge rat aboard the Flying Dutchman. I propose an exchange. Will leaves with us ... and you can have Jack.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Done.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Not done.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: Done.  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 97.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Elizabeth, love, you're condemning me. Again.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Jack is one of the Nine Pirate Lords. You have no right!

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: King. Barbossa frowns, realizes: Jack is up to something. Jack doffs his hat.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: As you command, your nibs. He starts to cross to Beckett -- Barbossa grabs Jack's shoulder and whirls him around even as he draws his sword

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Blaggar! Jack evades, but not quite -- Jack's circlet coin drops t the sand. Jack the Monkey scurries to pick up the coin. J raises his eyes to Barbossa. The two men regard each othe

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you have something to say, I might be saying something as well.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: First to the finish, then. Will and Jack complete the cross. Jones shoves Jack down.

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: Do you fear death?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: Advise your 'Brethren': you can fight and all of you will die. Or you can not fight, in which case only most of you will die.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: You murdered my father

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: He chose his own fate.  624 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 98.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: And you have chosen yours. We will fight ... and surely you will die.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: So be it. Elizabeth and Will turn away. Jack the Monkey drops the c into Barbossa's hand. Barbossa contemplates it, closes hi fist, follows. Still tense, with their backs exposed:

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: "King?"

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Of the Brethren Court. Courtesy of Jack. Will is impressed.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Maybe he really does know what he's doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is thrown into the cell, the door slammed shut. He l out through the bars as Maccus moves past.

dialogues.speaker: JACK RIGHT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Bravo! Jack turns his head -- PAN OVER -- JACK-RIGHT leans again the bars.

dialogues.speaker: JACK RIGHT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have arrived aboard the Flying Dutchman as per the overall scheme.

dialogues.speaker: JACK LEFT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh, yes, bravo! REVEAL: Another Jack to his left.

dialogues.speaker: JACK LEFT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Except for this little sojourn in the brig, it's utter clockwork.

dialogues.speaker: JACK RIGHT
dialogues.text: But we've got momentum on our side! A FOURTH JACK opens his EYES -- this one is well on his w to becoming part of the Dutchman, like Wyvern. He pulls a from the wall, exposing his brain.  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 99.

dialogues.speaker: WYVERN JACK
dialogues.text: Stab the heart! All three other Jacks look over at him.

dialogues.speaker: WYVERN JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Step foot ashore but once every ten years. But if you're in the brig then who's to stab the heart?

dialogues.speaker: JACK LEFT
dialogues.text: It does seem to put immortality a bit out of reach.

dialogues.speaker: JACK RIGHT
dialogues.text: Poppycock.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Poppycock?

dialogues.speaker: JACK LEFT
dialogues.text: He's never said 'poppycock.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I've never even thought 'poppycock.'

dialogues.speaker: JACK RIGHT
dialogues.text: Just then you did.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I did not -- All three suddenly clutch their heads and yell in pain. T look over at Wyvern Jack -- he's got his BRAIN in his HAN He squeezes it again; again, all three clutch their heads and yell in pain.

dialogues.speaker: JACK LEFT
dialogues.text: Should he being doing that?

dialogues.speaker: JACK RIGHT
dialogues.text: That can't be good for us! Wyvern Jack SQUEEZES again --

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Stop it! Stop! You're giving me a terrible headache -- And that reminds him of something:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whelp.  625 626 627 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, Elizabeth, Barbossa climb aboard.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: We'll need the Black Pearl to serve as our flagship, and lead the attack

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Will we, now? Will spots: TIA DALMA, being led onto deck by Pintel and several of the Chinese pirates. She is manacled, and boun with heavy ropes. Will knows what it means --

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Barbossa, you can't release her.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Can't I, now? Suddenly Chinese pirates surround he and Elizabeth, restr them. Barbossa gives Pintel and Ragetti an approving nod. They drag Tia Dalma to the mast.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: We've got to give Jack a chance!

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Apologies, your highness. But 'tis certain the world we know ends today, and I won't be letting the likes of Cutler Beckett say what comes next -- and I won't be pinning my hopes on Jack Sparrow, either. Too long has my fate not been in my own hands. No longer! He wraps his fist around the Captain's Knot Elizabeth wea then tears it free --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beckett returns to the command deck --

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: They have chosen oblivion. Ready the fleet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sails raise up and the Black Pearl leaps forward.  628 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ragetti presents the bowl with the pieces of eight to Barbossa, who puts in the Captain's Knot. SUDDENLY THE WIND DIES. They look up. All the sails are f All the ships are stopped.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Is there an incantation?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: (remembering) Aye, the items brought together done. Has to be performed over water we lucked out there. Items burned. And some person must speak the words, "Calypso, I release you from your human bonds."

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: "Twas said it must be spoken softly, as if to a lover. Barbossa grabs Gibbs' rum bottle, smashes it over the pil Shoves the punk into the pile --

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Calypso, I release you from your human bonds! All look at Tia Dalma as the items smolder. Nothing else happens.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: You didn't say it right! Everyone stares at Ragetti. Even Ragetti would stare at Ragetti if he could; he's surprised he spoke up.

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (defensive) You have to say it right. Ragetti steps up to Tia Dalma. Says softly and with genui love of the sea --  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 102.

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Calypso, I release you from your human bonds. The punk in the bowl bursts into FLAME, the flame licking upward in a twisting column -- and then its gone. The pie of eight decay, their age overtaking them -- Tia Dalma GASPS. She sags. The manacles on her hand becom pitted with corrosion, fragile with rust. She shudders, a they break, fall to the deck. Will struggles forward --

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Tia Dalma! Calypso! (she raises her eyes) When the Brethren Court first imprisoned you ... who was it that told them how? Who was it that betrayed you?

dialogues.speaker: TIA DALMA
dialogues.text: Name him.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Davy Jones. Her eyes shoot toward the Flying Dutchman, rage building behind them. And then -- 629 Tia Dalma_ starts to transform. Her eyes change color ripples with no wind. She rises up ... Crew members try t her. Ropes pull through their hands -- Then ropes snap. The deck buckles under he weight as she grows TENFOLD IN SIZE, a Harryhausen vision amid the sail Barbossa kneels; others follow suit.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Calypso. I come before you as but a servant, humble and contrite. I have fulfilled my vow, and now ask your favor. Spare my self, my ship, my crew -- but unleash your fury upon those who dare pretend themselves your masters, or mine! Calypso barely takes notice of him ... long enough to say single word that BOOMS out over the deck --

dialogues.speaker: FOOL
dialogues.text: 630 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 103. Barbossa's eyes go wide -- his long-odds gamble did not p off -- Then, suddenly, she collapses, crashes down to the deck i form of ten thousand crabs -- Crabs everywhere, a torrent running across the deck, toss pirates aside. Crabs flow out over the sides of the ship and Calypso is gone. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Why, she's no help at all! (to Barbossa) What now? The WIND PICKS UP AGAIN, causing the sails to shudder --

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Nothing. Our final hope has failed us. One of the pirate's hats is taken by the wind; it spirals and around the mast. Elizabeth watches it

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: It's not over Will overhears her.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Hope is not lost. There's still a fight to be had.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: There's an armada arrayed against us. We've got no chance of winnin'.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: (still watching the wind) Only a fool's chance ...

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Revenge won't bring your father back Miss Swann -- -- it's like a slap in the face to Elizabeth --

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: -- and it's not something I'm intending to die for. Elizabeth realizes: Nothing can bring her father back  WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 104.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: You're right. (beat) Then what shall we all die for? She steps up onto the rail of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to the crew) Listen to me! The Brethren will still be looking here, to us, to the Black Pearl, to lead. What will they see? Frightened bilge rats aboard a derelict ship? No. They will see free men. And freedom! And what the enemy will see is the flash of our cannons. They will hear the ring of our swords. And they will know what we can do -- (to Barbossa) -- by the sweat of our brows and the strength of our backs -- (to all) -- and the courage of our hearts. She casts a gaze around the deck, meeting the eyes of sev crewmen, ending on Will.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hoist the colours. Will nods, repeats it: low, resolved.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Hoist the colours.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Hoist the colours.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Hoist the colours It's picked up by the crew, a murmur as they move with pu to their stations, past and around Barbossa. One begins t sing softly "Yo ho, all hands, hoist the colours high ...

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: We've got the wind on our side, boys, and that's all we need! Elizabeth, still on the rail, turns to where the Empress lay, shouts across to Tai Huang:

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Hoist the colours!  631 632 633 634 635 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 105. ON ALL THE PIRATE SHIPS, FLAGS ARE RAISED. Different styl on white, red on black. Most with the skull and crossbone swords. The ships surge forward -- CREW MEMBERS start to SING, their voices rising together triumph ...

dialogues.speaker: PIRATES
dialogues.text: Yo, ho, haul together, hoist the colors high ... heave ho, thieves and beggars, never say we die!

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Target the Flying Dutchman. We're the only ship that can catch her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE ENDEAVOUR, Beckett sips tea. Officer Groves approa

dialogues.speaker: GROVES
dialogues.text: We have a favorable wind, sir Beckett looks up, noticing. Utterly casual.

dialogues.speaker: BECKETT
dialogues.text: So we do. Signal Jones. "No quarter." That should brighten his day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SIGNALMAN waves flags, as seen from the Dutchman --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the upper deck, Mercer screams out:

dialogues.speaker: MERCER
dialogues.text: To arms! We will give no quarter! The crew answers, HUZZAH! Davy Jones turns away, as the W RISES, he looks up into the sky ... his hand moves toward his chest

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: Calypso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clouds above begin to ROTATE, forming a storm disk in the sky -- lightening strikes down at sea -- IN THE CARIBBEAN SEA, a GIANT WHIRLPOOL begins to turn sl Sheets of rain begin to fall -- 631 632 633 634 635  636 637 638 639 WHITE REVISION 7-4-07 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM ABOVE -- the two formations converge, the Black Pear outpacing the pirate fleet, the Dutchman outpacing the Ar Between them the sea continues to swirl ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs stares at the sea with a practiced eye --

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Maelstrom! Saints preserve us! A moment as they all take stock of the dire situation.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Captain Barbossa! Barbossa looks up (he was contemplating his now-mortal ha

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I need you at the helm.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Aye, that be true! (takes the wheel from Cotton) Brace the yards! Set the stay sails and turn her windward! SHIPS of the ARMADA and the FLEET turn away. The BLACK PE turns. But the FLYING DUTCHMAN and the BLACK PEARL are ca
